summary: type b aortic dissection extending from the distal arch to before the inferior mesenteric artery.slight interval thrombosis of the superior aspect of the false lumen, without increase in size of dissection, true lumen, or aorta itself.unchanged appearance of the patency of renal and mesenteric arteries.right renal artery remains fed by the false lumen.stable appearance of bilateral pleural effusions.associated compressive atelectasis.preliminary findings were relayed to the ed dashboard at time of interpretation, approximately 10:30 a.m., ___.

text: there are multiple prominent mediastinal lymph nodes in the pretracheal region (2, 24) and in the prevascular space (2, 19), none of which meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.a prominent lymph node in the subcarinal space (2, 33) is also identified, although its margins are unclear to make accurate measurements.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.there is diffuse bilateral ground-glass opacities seen throughout the lungs.there is no focal consolidation identified.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there is no axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.
summary: diffuse bilateral pulmonary ground-glass opacities could represent pulmonary edema or infection.ascites within the perihepatic space and dependent portions of pelvis along with anasarca.marked gallbladder wall thickening and edema is non-specific and can be ssen with hepatitis and third spacing.there is no evidence of cholelithiasis or intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation.cecal and ascending colonic wall thickening with fat stranding.these findings could be secondary to inflammatory or infectious proess, but can also be seen with hepatitis and hepatic insufficiency.further evaluation with colonoscopy once the patient's clinical status improves shold be considered.findings were discussed with the resident covering dr.___ ___ pager at 11:00 a.m.via telephone.

text: a left chest tube enters between the left fourth and fifth anterior ribs and terminates in the left lung base.a pericardial drain entering between the left fifth and sixth anterior ribs and terminates in the anteroinferior pericardium.nasogastric and endotracheal tubes remain in place.a moderately large pericardial effusion is slightly larger than on ___, without a definite evidence of loculation.fluid extends into all major pericardial recesses therefore obscuring large portions of the mediastinal fat.evaluation of the mediastinum is further limited by the presence of multiple nonenhancing mediastinal lymph nodes.the largest lymph node conglomeration in the right paratracheal (2:14) is stable in size at 44 x 22 mm.a 12 mm right hilar lymph node is newly visualized with the presence of iv contrast.a small left pleural effusion is decreased from ___, but increased since ___, with possible loculation.passive atelectasis of the left lower lobe has also increased.a small right pleural effusion, with adjacent passive atelectasis has improved slightly.new since prior exam, are multiple round peribronchial opacities in the right middle lobe and lower lobe, which are concerning for infection, possibly aspiration.imaging of the upper abdomen is not sufficient for diagnosis.heterogeneous enhancement of the liver parenchyma likely reflects underlying right heart failure.other than a small, stable amount of perihepatic ascites, the upper abdomen is unremarkable.
summary: slight interval increase in size of pericardial effusion since ___.fluid throughout the mediastinum likely represents prominent, distended pericardial reflections.new peribronchial opacities in the right middle lobe and lower lobe are consistent with infection, possibly aspiration.left lower lobe effusion and atelectasis are increased from ___.loculation of the small effusion is not excluded.decreasing small right pleural effusion with passive atelectasis.stable mediastinal lymphadenopathy.heterogeneous liver enhancement likely reflects underlying right heart failure and correlation with echocardiogram is recommended.stable small perihepatic ascites.

text: the previously seen dominant opacity within the right upper lobe, today, seen best on series 2, image 24, previously seen best on series 2, image 23 from ___ chest ct.this lesion has decreased in size.however, there are multiple new ill-defined small opacities scattered throughout the lungs bilaterally that could represent infectious etiology.these lesions are predominantly 1 cm or less.there is interval increase in size of a previously seen small left pleural effusion, which now is moderate-to-large in size.several calcified granulomas are again noted bilaterally and unchanged.multiple borderline mediastinal lymph nodes are again seen and unchanged.the aorta is tortuous and calcified.
summary: interval development of multiple nodular densities scattered throughout the lungs, which given time interval is more likely to be of infectious or inflammatory etiology.of note, the more dominant lesion seen within the right upper lung appears improved compared to prior study.there are multiple new nodular densities elsewhere within the lung.unchanged liver hypodensities, too small to characterize.multiple calcific foci within the lung, liver, spleen, and mesentery consistent with prior granulomatous disease.bilateral inguinal hernias containing bowel with no evidence of incarceration.interval increase in left pleural effusion, now moderate-to-large in size, previously small.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at the time of dictation.

text: the pulmonary arteries are well opacified up to subsegmental levels, without evidence of acute pulmonary embolism.the thoracic aorta is normal in course and appearance, without evidence of acute thoracic aortic pathology.the heart and pericardium are normal.the major airways are patent to subsegmental levels bilaterally.multiple pulmonary nodules with irregular margins are seen in both lungs.the largest in the right upper lobe measures 1.9 x 1.7 cm (2:28) and the largest in the lingula measures 2.0 x 1.5 cm.there is suggestion of cavitation within one of the smaller nodules in the right lower lobe (2:54).majority of these nodules have vessel traversing through the lesion.small reactive right and left hilar nodes are present.no significant axillary or mediastinal adenopathy is seen.residual thymic tissue is present.no pleural effusion or pneumothorax is seen.this study is not tailored for evaluation of the subdiaphragmatic organs.within this limitation, the imaged upper abdomen is unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of acute pulmonary embolism or thoracic aortic pathology.multiple nodules in both lungs, with suggestion of cavitation in a single nodule.the differential considerations include multifocal infections, with etiologies including fungal and nocardia infection and malignancy such as lymphoma.septic emboli is considered unlikely given the time course of progression.recommended biopsy for further evaluation.the above findings and recommendation were discussed with dr.___ at 9:20 a.m on ___.

text: subcentimeter left thyroid nodule is noted.there is an endotracheal tube with the tip approximately 2.5 cm above the carina.a soft tissue attenuating material within the trachea likely represents mucosal secretion.subcentimeter mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes are seen.there is no lymphadenopathy by size criteria.the aorta is calcified with no evidence of aneurysm or injury.the heart is not enlarged.there is no pericardial effusion.an ng tube is present with the tip coiled within the stomach.no pneumothorax or pulmonary contusion is seen.numerous pleural plaques some of which are calcified are noted within bilateral lungs.focal area of opacity with an apparent comet tailing in the right lower lobe likely represents rounded atelectasis.interstitial thickening versus atelectatic changes of the lung paranchyma are noted.
summary: no evidence of acute trauma to the chest, abdomen or pelvis.multiple pleural plaques, some of which are calcified consistent with asbestos-related pleural disease and probable parenchymal changes.patient is status post roux-en-y gastric bypass and small amount of pneumobilia.severely atrophic right kidney.severely atherosclerotic aorta.punctate calcifications in the liver consistent with prior granulomatous disease.bilateral fat containing inguinal hernias.

text: the multiple subcentimeter thyroid nodules are unchanged.there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar adenopathy.the patient had prior right pneumonectomy.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no pericardial effusion.there is persistent fluid in the pneumonectomy sac.as on prior study, the soft tissue nodular focus abuts the posterior pleural surface measuring approximately 14 x 7 mm compared to 25 x 10 mm on prior (2, 31 today).nodularity in the pleural surface is similar.the anterior fifth rib soft tissue nodule consistent with metastatic disease is unchanged (2, 34).the right pulmonary artery trunk thrombus is unchanged and consistent with prior surgery.
summary: slight size decrease of the right pelvic soft tissue mass.small thrombus in the right pulmonary artery trunk is unchanged.prior right pneumonectomy with residual nodularity of the pleura.right fifth rib metastasis.

text: there is interval development of a sizable left pneumothorax with perhaps slight shift of the mediastinal contents towards the right since ct torso of ___.also note is made that the patient has left-sided anterior chest tube is not within the pleural cavity and terminates within the subcutaneous soft tissues of the anterolateral chest wall.there is subcutaneous gas along bilateral anterior chest wall.also, there is apparent gas within the anterior mediastinum (2:16), and also along the right heart margin (2:4, 31, 57).the central airways are patent to the subsegmental levels.there are areas of consolidation in the dependent portions involving all lobes of the lungs, possibly representing atelectasis and possible aspiration.additionally, there are multiple foci of peribronchovascular nodules and consolidation which are most prominent in the left upper lobe, right middle lobe and right lower lobe, worrisome for multifocal pneumonia.there is no pleural effusion or pericardial effusion.while the study is degraded by motion, no evidence for large or central pulmonary embolus is seen.assessment is particularly limited in the lingula.no mediastinal, hilar or axillary adenopathy is noted.again noted is thymic tissue remnant.no evidence of acute fracture seen.vertebral body heights are preserved.
summary: enlarged now moderate-to-large left pneumothorax.left chest tube terminates in the anterolateral subcutaneous soft tissues of the chest wall.slight rightward shift of midline structures.pneumomediastinum.subcutaneous gas along bilateral anterior chest wall, tracking up to the thoracic inlet on the left.right chest wall laceration.multifocal consolidation involving all lobes of the lungs, likely due to aspiration and pneumonia.assessment is slightly limited due to respiratory motion, particularly along the lingula, but no evidence of pe seen.findings discussed with dr.___ ___ over the phone at 10:15 a.m.

text: there are multiple enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes.for example, two adjacent right paratracheal nodes measure 16 x 12 and 15 x 13 mm in axial dimensions, respectively.more superiorly, a right upper paratracheal lymph node measures 15 x 13 mm, and a subcarinal node measures 28 x 17 mm.there is also lymphadenopathy in the right hilum, with a node measuring up to 18 x 11 mm.there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.it is difficult to assess for left hilar lymphadenopathy because of the presence of a partially collapsed left lung.the heart, great vessels, and pericardium are unremarkable.there is no pericardial effusion or evidence of pulmonary embolism.there is a moderately large pneumothorax in the left hemithorax, in spite of the presence of a chest tube.there is also a small left pleural effusion.in the left hemithorax, neither the lower or upper lobe has fully reexpanded and both appear surrounded by visceral pleural thickening, particularly the upper lobe.there are also atelectatic changes within the residual lobes and ground glass opacity.in the right lung, there are multiple areas of ground glass opacity and septal thickening.in comparison to the chest radiographs, this appearance has progressed over two days, and although the appearance is nonspecific by imaging, pulmonary edema is suspected.limited views of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.
summary: persistent hydropneumothorax on the left, in spite of the presence of the chest tube.partially collapsed left upper and lower lobes, which are surrounded by visceral pleural thickening.the differential for this appearance includes metastatic disease, primary lung cancer, mesothelioma, and potentially lymphoma.mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy.diffuse patchy ground glass opacities and septal thickening in the right lung, progressive over two days, which may represent pulmonary edema, given its rapid onset.

text: over 20 days a right apical lung mass has grown to 16 x 17mm from 11 x 15 mm (3:14).the left apical lung nodule, 7.1 x 15 mm, a 3mm upper lobe nodule (3:16), and a 2.6mm right upper lobe nodule (3:27) with a rounded central lucency are all stable.th large left hilar mass is stable in size but more completely occludes the the left basal bronchial trunk with complete collapse of the left lower lobe.the left pleural effusion has increased, now moderate to severe, although no pleural mass is seen.there is no right pleural effusion.small pericardial effusion is stable, with no evidence of cardiad tamponade.heart size is normal.among sultiple, pathologically enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes, some have grown: the 2.7 x 2.5 cm subcarinal lymph node was previously 2.2 x 2.1 cm..a well-defined sclerotic region in the posterior one-third of a mid thoracic vertebral body is likely a bone island.no ill-defined sclerotic lesions suspicious for metastases are seen.the limited evaluation of the abdomen shows a progressive increase in the size of the cystic splenic lesion arising from the upper pole of the spleen 30 x 30 mm; when first identified on the ___, it measured 8.5 mm.the gallbladder has been removed.the limited evaluation of the abdomen demonstrates no definite abnormality although the previous examination detected some tiny hypodense lesions too small to characterize on this examination.
summary: large, left hilar mass more completely obliterating the basal trunk of the left bronchus lower lobe bronchus, causing complete collapse of the left lower lobe, and enlarging subcarinal lymphadenopathy, right upper lobe lung mass, and moderate size, left pleural effusion all indicate metastatic progression.progressive increase of a splenic cystic lesion of unclear clinical significance that can be electively evaluated by a splenic ultrasound examination.

text: due to a combination of poor peripheral opacification and motion artifact, the subsegmental pulmonary arteries are not well shown.however, there is no evidence of a central pulmonary embolism.a tracheostomy tube and right subclavian central venous catheter are in satisfactory position.anterior bowing of the posterior tracheal membrane leads to subtotal collapse of the upper trachea, approximately 5 mm below the tip of the endotracheal tube (401b:32).mid and lower tracheal collapse is also severe, but less marked.similarly, there is severe collapse of the main bronchi bilaterally and evidence of air trapping in both lungs, particularly the left upper lobe.bilateral lower lobe atelectasis is moderately severe, segmental consolidation in the right lower lobe suggests concomitant segmental pneumonia.bilateral pleural effusions appear nonhemorrhagic and are small with a trace of right minor fissural fluid and adjacent compressive atelectasis.mild mediastinal nodal prominence is likely reactive to the consolidation.the cardiac size is normal without evidence of pericardial effusion.coronary artery and thoracic aortic arch atherosclerotic calcification is mild-to-moderate.descending thoracic aortic calcification is moderately severe.the study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, only to confirm a small sliding hiatal hernia, and a gastrostomy tube.the visualized osseous structures are unremarkable aside from mid and lower thoracic spine endplate irregularity.
summary: technically limited study with no evidence of a central (main, lobar or segmental) pulmonary embolism.diffuse, severe tracheomalacia below the level of the tracheostomy tube with associated moderately severe air trapping in both lungs.small bilateral pleural effusions, bilateral lower lobe atelectasis and consolidation in the right lower lobe.the results were communicated by telephone to clinical team member, dr.___ at approximately 19:00 hours, ___.

text: there has been no significant change in the appearance of the lungs when compared to prior examination.as in the prior study, there is extensive right lower lobe consolidation with a cavitary component.there are scattered nodular and ground-glass opacities throughout the lungs.in addition, there is more mild bronchiectatic change within the left lower lobe.several lymph nodes are again identified within the prevascular space, right paratracheal space and subcarinal region.calcified aorta is noted.the heart and great vessels are grossly unremarkable.within the anterior right lobe of the liver, there is a peripherally enhancing lesion measuring approximately 2.5 x 1.5 cm, likely representing hemangioma.there is a well-circumscribed hypodense lesion measuring 1.5 x 1.0 cm within the left lobe, representing a cyst.these lesions are unchanged when compared to prior exam.there is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation.the gallbladder, pancreas and adrenal glands are unremarkable.a single tiny calcification is noted within the spleen.there is a 9 mm hypoattenuating lesion within the lower pole of the right kidney, too small to characterize.the left kidney is unremarkable.no evidence for kidney stones or hydronephrosis.there are multiple subcentimeter mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymphs nodes, unchanged.no evidence for dilated bowel, bowel wall thickening or obstruction.there is a tiny amount of free fluid in the pelvis.a moderate amount of stool is seen throughout a nondistended colon.there is no evidence for free air.a foley catheter is noted within the bladder.severe levoscoliosis of the lumbar spine and degenerative changes are noted.
summary: no evidence for an intraabdominal process.no significant change in the appearance of the lungs including right lower lobe consolidation with cavitary component, scattered bilateral ground glass and nodular opacities and left lower lobe bronchiectatic change.multiple lymph nodes within the chest and abdomen, likely related to patient's history of lymphoma.evaluation of the reformatted images was valuable in delineating the anatomy.

text: no central, segmental, or subsegmental filling defects to suggest pulmonary emboli within the pulmonary arteries.increased caliber of the main pulmonary artery and proximal left and right pulmonary arteries concerning for pulmonary arterial hypertension.thoracic aorta is normal in caliber.scattered atherosclerotic calcifications with mural nonocclusive clot.atherosclerosis of the coronary arteries, mitral/aortic valve annulus.cardiac size overall within normal limits.no significant pericardial effusion.prominent precarinal lymph node measuring up to 1.1 cm in short axis.additional smaller lymph nodes are seen scattered within the mediastinum.subcentimeter axillary lymph nodes are seen, none pathologically enlarged.the endotracheal tube terminates in the mid trachea, well positioned above the carina.ng tube extends into the stomach, which appears decompressed, partially included.right subclavian central venous catheter terminates in the distal svc.no pneumothorax, significant pleural effusion, or lung parenchymal masses.centrilobular emphysema with apical predominance.endobronchial tree is patent centrally.dependent atelectasis at the right lung base.atlectasis and/or consolidation at the left lung base with some preserved air bronchograms.probable atelectasis of the lingula.partially included upper abdomen demonstrates coarse calcifications of the liver and spleen compatible with granulomas.probable calcified nodes in the epigastrium near the ge junction.fullness of partially included adrenal glands.mild degenerative changes of the visualized spine.
summary: atelectasis and/ or consolidation left lung base, with some preserved air bronchograms.no pulmonary embolus.increased caliber of the central pulmonary arteries, a finding that can be seen in pulmonary arterial hypertension.centrilobular emphysema with apical predominance.granulomas of the spleen, liver, with calcified lymph nodes in the epigastrium.

text: the heart is normal in size.several prominent mediastinal lymph nodes are identified measuring up to 8 mm in short axis in the prevascular station.no mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes meet criteria for lymphadenopathy.there is no pericardial effusion.the trachea and central bronchi are patent.there are multifocal areas of dense consolidation noted throughout both lungs, most severe within the left lower lobe which is nearly completely opacified.the superior segment of the left lower lobe demonstrates moderate aeration.there is marked mucus plugging noted within the segmental and subsegmental bronchi of the left lower lobe basal segments.also noted are tree-in-___ opacities and ground-glass opacities predominantly within the right lower lobe.there is a small left pleural effusion.within the right upper lobe, there is a region of dense airspace consolidation with a small central lucency, which may represent either early cavitation or a segmental portion of a patent bronchus.the airspace consolidations, some are predominantly peribronchial in location, and some are surrounded by ground-glass opacities.the right pleural space is unremarkable.there is no pleural enhancement to suggest empyema.no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions are noted within the visualized osseous structures.although this study was not designed for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, images of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.
summary: multifocal areas of airspace consolidation throughout both lungs consistent with multifocal pneumonia.right upper lobe consolidation with a central lucency could represent either early cavitation or a segmental portion of a patent bronchus within an area of consolidation.small left pleural effusion and prominent mediastinal lymph nodes, likely reactive in nature.

text: the airways are patent to the segmental level.again demonstrated involving the posterior medial aspect of the right upper lobe is a large area of mass-like consolidation demonstrating superimposed radiation change, which per report represents a path proven metastatic lesion.allowing for differences in technique, this lesion has not changed in size or appearance.it continues to encase the right main bronchus, right upper lobe bronchus as well as several pulmonary arterial branches in this region.there is basilar atelectasis, but no new concerning areas of consolidation or nodules throughout the lungs.no enlarged adenopathy is seen within the axillary, mediastinal, or hilar distributions.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are unremarkable.
summary: interval increase in enhancing soft tissue nodule in the subcutaneous tissues posterior to the left iliac bone at the level of the si joint; this lesion remains suspicious for a metastasis and would be easily amenable to percutaneous biopsy if clinically warranted.essentially stable size and appearance of the posteriomedial right upper lobe mass, with superimposed radiation change.status post right nephrectomy; no evidence of local recurrence in the nephrectomy bed or new metastatic lesions throughout the torso.tiny hypodense lesions in the left kidney, most likely simple cysts, but too small to characterize.

text: no filling defect is seen in the main, right and pulmonary arteries and their branches to suggest pulmonary embolus.thoracic aorta is grossly within normal limits.the heart is upper limits of normal.there is no mediastinal, hilar or left axillary lymphadenopathy.there is a mildly prominent right axillary lymph node; however, it is not enlarged by ct criteria.central airways are unremarkable.a 2-mm subpleural nodule is seen in the right lateral base (3:70), slightly more conspicuous than the prior study but otherwise grossly unchanged since ___.there is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.structures in the thoracic inlet are grossly unremarkable.right hepatic lobe hypodense lesions are seen, not completely characterized on the current study.these hepatic lesions were previously described as metastatic disease and accurate comparison cannot be made to the prior study due to differences in technique.visualized spleen and pancreas are grossly unremarkable.the left adrenal gland is mildly prominent, which could represent hyperplasia.left chest wall mediport is seen with the venous catheter tip in the mid svc.subcutaneous tissues are grossly unremarkable.small sclerotic focus is noted in the lower thoracic vertebral body, which likely represents an enostosis, unchanged.old fracture deformities are seen in the right lower anterior ribs, unchanged.
summary: no pulmonary embolus.interval calcification of 3-mm right lower lobe nodule.another tiny (2 mm) subpleural nodule in the right base is unchanged when compared to ___.no followup is necessary for these lesions.metastatic hepatic lesions partially visualized.

text: on the lung windows, there is a tiny left apical pneumothorax which is stable when compared with the previous ct from 12 hours previously.there is airspace disease in the left upper lobe particularly the apex and this appears to have reduced slightly in size when compared with the previous ct and the appearances are consistent with a contusion.some minimal fluid is noted in the pleural spaces bilaterally, left more than right side.a tiny pocket of air is seen in relation to the right posterolateral aspect of the trachea.this is not increased in size and was identified on the previous ct.as mentioned previously, this may represent a tracheal diverticulum or alternatively may represent a small air leak.however, this has not progressed and is unchanged.no focal lung nodules identified.on the mediastinal windows, given that this is a non-contrast ct, no evidence of any significant mediastinal lymphadenopathy.upper cuts of the liver and spleen are normal.bony windows reveal a comminuted fracture of the outer third of the left clavicle.multiplanar reconstructions were essential in depicting the anatomy and identifying the pathology.
summary: tiny bleb of air seen in the posterolateral aspect of the right side of the trachea which is unchanged when compared with the previous ct from 12 hours previously and most likely represents tracheal diverticulum.left upper lobe contusion which appears to have decreased slightly and unchanged tiny left apical pneumothorax.left clavicular fracture.

text: there aer no filling defects seen within the pulmonary arteries to suggest the presence of pulmonary embolis.again seen is a large left hilar/suprahilar mass which is probably not significantly changed in size.there is continued obstruction of the left upper lobe bronchus with left upper lobe collapse.in addition, the hilar mass encases the left main pulmonary artery.multiple mediastinal lymph nodes are seen, predominantly in a pre-vascular distribution.these are overall not significantly changed in size.other lymph nodes are seen in a right paratracheal location.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.these are new since the previous exam.no new lung nodules are seen.no suspicious osseous lesions are identified.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolis.stable left hilar/suprahilar mass with left upper lobe collapse.new small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.stable mediastinal lymphadenopathy.

text: airways are patent up to subsegmental level.there is interval increase in right pleural effusion, now moderate in size, with adjacent atelectasis at the right lung base.there is a minimal left pleural effusion, and similar atelectasis at the left lung base.a small right pneumothorax persists after removal of the pleural tube the patient is status post sternotomy, with multiple sternotomy wires.there is a small residual mediastinal hematoma, (2:82), with mild interval decrease in size, and foci of air within, probably from removal of previously seen mediastinal drains.there is no evidence of pericardial effusion.unusual out- pouching of contrast is seen along anterior right atrium lateral to plane of tricuspid valve, which developed between ___ and ___ and is similar from ___, concerning for pseudoaneurysm, of the right atrium, right ventricle or right coronary artery (2:72, and 303b:41).there is no evidence of active extravasation.there are no pulmonary emboli.vascular stent in the left subclavian vein is noted.no mediastinal, axillary, and hilar lymphadenopathy is seen according to ct size criteria.the study is not designed to evaluate subdiaphragmatic contents.
summary: unusual outpouching of contrast along the anterior right atrium lateral to plane of tricuspid valve, new since ___, and stable since ___, concerning for pseudoaneurysm, or less likely diverticulum.echo, or cardiac mri if there is no contraindication can be done to evaluate further.finding was discussed with ___ ___, np at 3 p.m.on ___.persistent small mediastinal hematoma, with minimal interval decrease in size compared to prior, with a few foci of air, possibly from removal of mediastinal drains.interval increase in nonhemorrhagic moderate-sized right pleural effusion, with adjacent atelectasis.similar minimal persistent left pleural effusion, with atelectasis at the left lung base.no pulmonary emboli.no pericardial effusion.persistent small apical right pneumothorax.

text: a port-a-cath terminates at the cavoatrial junction.there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.the heart, great vessels, and pericardium are unremarkable.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.the patient is again status post wedge resections from the right upper and lower lobes.focal post-operative scarring and bronchiectasis along the right medial apical suture line is unchanged.there is similar right apical pleural thickening.multiple lung nodules are again present.the largest in the right hemithorax is located in the superior segment of the right lower lobe and again measures 8 mm in diameter.several left-sided lung nodules, the largest a 7- mm nodule in the superior segment of the left lower lobe, are also unchanged.
summary: stable bilateral lung nodules and post-operative changes in the right hemithorax.sclerosis in the left sacrum most consistent a metastasis.a much less likely differential consideration would be a recent sacral insufficiency fracture, but the recent pet-ct abnormality appeared mass-like and no fracture line is identified.

text: ct of the chest with contrast: there is extensive pulmonary emboli throughout bilateral pulmonary arteries beginning from the distal main pulmonary branches extending into all the lobar branches and subsegmentally.there is evidence of right heart strain.the patient is intubated with endotracheal tube ending approximately 5 cm above the carina.an ng tube courses into the stomach.there are small centrilobular nodules in the right lower lobe.there are trace bilateral pleural effusions.there is no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.the heart size is normal without pericardial effusion.coronary artery calcifications are present.
summary: extensive pulmonary emboli extending from the distal pulmonary arteries bilaterally into eventually every major branch down to the subsegmental level.there is significant overall thrombus burden and evidence of right heart strain.enhancing right renal mass which has increased in size since ___, concerning for malignancy.further workup is recommended.stable pancreatic duct dilatation when compared to ___.again, the differential includes ipmn or obstruction from ampullary stenosis.splenomegaly.findings of item #___.___, ___ attending, at the time of review on ___.

text: consolidations in the medial and posterior basal segments of the right lower lobe are increased.a rounded consolidation in the superior segment of the right lower lobe is decreased.trace effusion on the right is also slightly increased.on the left, consolidation in the basal segment of the lower lobe is decreased; however, there is new consolidation in the superior segment with minimally increased small layering pleural effusion.a calcified right middle lobe granuloma is present (4:124).a 3-mm nodule in the anterior right upper lobe (4:102) is stable over greater than two years from the examination of ___.several prominent lymph nodes at the thoracic inlet and at the left paratracheal station measuring under 10 mm in short axis are similar to the prior examinations.these were present on the exam of ___, prior to the infection, however have now slightly increased in size.for example, a paratracheal node measuring 9 mm (4:96) was 10 mm in ___ and 6 mm in ___.there are vascular calcifications notable within the left main and anterior descending coronary arteries.pericardial fluid is within physiologic limits.a right-sided picc is in place with tip in the svc.no evidence of endobronchial lesion is seen.there is a small hiatal hernia.there is some tortuosity of the aorta, however, no aneurysm is seen.this study is not tailored for evaluation beneath the diaphragm; limited views of the upper abdomen demonstrate slightly heterogeneous liver as compared to prior examinations which could be pathologic, though given timing of contrast, this is most likely perfusional.there is evidence of remote right posterior rib fracture.no concerning osseous lesion is seen.
summary: increased consolidations, predominantly in the medial and posterior basal segments of the right lower lobe, concerning for pneumonia.decreased consolidations in the superior segments of the right lower lobe and in the basal segments of the left lower lobe.on the left, the appearance on this examination could be entirely explained by atelectasis.small pleural effusions, left greater than right, increased in size from the prior examination.

text: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.aorta appears intact.no pericardial effusion.there no pathologically enlarged axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymph nodes.several possible tiny bilateral nodules are unchanged compared exam of ___.there are bilateral lower lobe atelectasis.the airways appear patent to the level of segmental bronchi bilaterally.there is no evidence of pneumothorax.no pleural effusion.limited images of the upper abdomen demonstrate a stable low density right kidney lesion that may represent a cyst.patient appears to be status post cholecystectomy.bone windows reveal no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.a 4.6 cm hypodense, stable lesion in the right kidney that may represent a cyst.

text: the pulmonary artery measures at upper limits of normal 28 mm in diameter.there is no main or segmental branch embolus identified.respiratory motion limits evaluation of the subsegmental branches, although no secondary signs of pe are noted.the heart is enlarged.there is a mechanical prosthetic mitral valve.there is evidence of prior bypass surgery.stents are evident in the left anterior descending, ramus intermedius, and left circumflex arteries.pacemaker wires are indwelling.the pacemaker generator is in the soft tissues of the left anterior chest wall and result in significant streak artifact throughout the upper contrast, limiting the evaluation as well.there is a 12 mm precarinal lymph node, 12 mm subcarinal lymph node, and 15 mm right hilar lymph node.there is no pneumomediastinum.the esophagus image is normally.there is a bovine arch.the aorta is unremarkable otherwise.the visualized subdiaphragmatic viscera is unremarkable.there is diffuse pulmonary edema predominantly in a central "bat ___" distribution with interlobular septal thickening as well.respiratory motion again severely limits the evaluation of the lung parenchyma.a small right pleural effusion is evident.mild spondylotic change is noted throughout the mid thoracic spine.no blastic or lytic lesions are evident.as previously noted sternotomy wires are seen through the sternum.
summary: findings consistent with hydrostatic edema secondary to cardiac decompensation.suboptimal evaluation for subsegmental distal pulmonary embolus.no main pulmonary or segmental artery embolus identified.non- specific mediastinal lymphadenopathy as detailed above.

text: several of the previously noted lung nodules have increased in size.a nodule within the left upper lobe now measures 7 mm and demonstrates a small area of cavitation.a second left upper lobe nodule is unchanged.a nodule within the right upper lobe now measures 8 mm in size.the largest nodule identified, and which has also increased in size, now measures 13 mm, previously 4 mm.this nodule too demonstrates central cavitation.a single 1-mm tiny subpleural nodule in the left lower lobe and 3-mm nodule in the right middle lobe are unchanged.there are no areas of consolidation or pleural effusions.the patient is status post left mastectomy.peripheral pleural-parenchymal changes are seen anteriorly at the level of the second and third ribs, as expected from prior radiation treatment.there is no mediastinal or axillary lymphadenopathy.a well-defined sclerotic lesion within the sternum is unchanged since ___, and likely represents a bone island.no suspicious lesions are seen.within the imaged portions of the upper abdomen, there is no change to focal hypodense lesions within the left lobe of the liver, too small to characterize.the patient is status post cholecystectomy.
summary: interval increase in size of several pulmonary nodules, some of which demonstrate cavitation.findings are consistent with metastatic disease.

text: the heart is normal in size, with a trace pericardial effusion.a left picc terminates within the proximal right atrium.central lymph nodes are not pathologically enlarged.there is a large anterior left hydropneumothorax, with two, possibly three, additional loculated hydropneumothoraces posteriorly.there is near complete collapse of the left lower lobe, with only partial aeration of the superior segment.though there is a left basal chest tube, the chest tube lies directly along the left hemidiaphragm and immediately inferior to the collapsed left lower lobe, rather than being centered within the hydropneumothoraces.no abnormal pleural enhancement or pleural mass is identified.a right pleural effusion is moderate in size and is associated with right basilar atelectasis.the lungs are otherwise clear.this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation other than to note normal-appearing adrenal glands.osseous structures reveal no suspicious abnormality.
summary: loculated foci of large left hydropneumothoraces, with associated near complete collapse of the left lower lobe.though a basal chest tube is present, the tube is bounded by the collapsed lower lobe and the hemidiaphragm rather than being centered within the loculated foci of hydropneumothoraces.moderate right pleural effusion, associated with basilar atelectasis.trace pericardial effusion.findings were discussed with dr.___ at approximately 5 p.m.on ___.

text: soft tissue window images demonstrate a right paratracheal mediastinal lymph node, which measures 11 mm (series 3, image 22) compared to 10 mm in the prior study.there is a small cluster of non-enlarged lymph nodes in the ap window, which appears stable.the great vessels and heart and pericardium are normal in appearance.no pleural effusions are seen.lung window images demonstrate multiple pulmonary nodules again noted.the largest of these is in the left lower lobe, (series 3, image 51) which measures 13 x 11 mm compared to 9 x 7 mm (series 4, image 50) compared to the prior exam.multiple other pulmonary nodules are seen within both lungs, all of which appear slightly increased in comparison to the prior study.additionally, there is a right hilar lymph node/nodule, which measures 22 x 21 mm (series 3, image 36) compared to 18 x 17 mm (series 4, image 39).
summary: there is a large left renal mass again seen, which appears slightly larger measuring 15 x 12 cm on this study.additionally, there is extension into the left renal vein with tumor thrombus again noted.the tumor thrombus does not extend beyond the level of the aorta.multiple pulmonary nodules are again seen, the largest of which measures 13 x 11 mm.all of these have increased slightly in size in comparison to the prior study.

text: the is satisfactory contrast opacification to the segmental level.filling defects in the posterior and lateral segmental and subsegmental right lower lobe pulmonary arteries (3.58.59.60) are consistent with pulmonary emboli.no aortic dissection or aneurysm.allowing for respiratory motion artifact in the lower lobes bilaterally the lungs are clear with exception of a calcified granuloma of the right apex (3.16).airways are widely patent to subsegmental level bilaterally.the pleural surfaces are smooth with no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.no pathologically enlarged mediastinal or axillary lymph nodes by ct size criteria.the aorta, pulmonary artery and heart size is normal.no pericardial effusion.the examination was not designed for subdiaphragmatic evaluation except to note a small nonobstructing right renal calculus.no destructive or sclerotic bone lesions.
summary: right lower lobe segmental and subsegmental pulmonary emboli.dr.___ ___ was contact___ at 2:30 a.m.on ___ by dr ___

text: 26 x 12 mm spiculated nodule in the right apex (3:12) is new.mass- like consolidation and soft tissue inferior to the right bronchial stump and extensive interstitial abnormality in the right base are worse.ground-glass nodular opacities in the left lower lobe (3:29) are new.moderate emphysema is unchanged.the left perihilar radiation change is stable.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.nonenlarged paratracheal and subcarinal lymph nodes are stable.12 mm right hilar lymph node (2:25), was 8 mm.bilateral axillary lymphadenopathy, mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy is stable.cholelithiasis.the imaged portions of the liver, spleen, adrenal glands, pancreas and kidneys are unremarkable.there are no bone findings of malignancy.
summary: enlarging right perihilar tumor and new right apical nodule likely due to tumor recurrence interstitial abnormality in the right base could be to lymphangitic engorgement or interstitial pneumonia, followup in three months is recomended.stable left perihilar radiation changes.retroperitoneal, mesenteric and axillary lymphadenopathy is consistent with patient's history of cll.gallstones.

text: extensive upper lobe predominant paraseptal and centrilobular emphysema is again seen.a spiculated 11 x 10 mm right upper lobe nodule (3, 38) is new.a 4-mm nodule along the minor fissure on the right (3, 66) is stable.a spiculated nodule in the superior segment of the right lower lobe has resolved, as has a nodular density in the right lower lobe abutting the major fissure.an 11 x 7 mm subpleural density in the medial right middle lobe (3, 86) is unchanged, likely represents a focus of atelectasis.what appears to be suture line is seen in the right lung apex.there are two small hypoattenuating nodules in the left thyroid lobe.non-pathologically enlarged pretracheal and paratracheal lymph nodes measuring up to 8 mm in short axis are stable.a right hilar node is stable, measuring 2.1 x 1.4 cm (3, 57).the heart size is stable.the right and left pulmonary arteries are 3 cm in diameter, as before.calcifications of the native coronary arteries are extensive.there is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.the central airways are patent.
summary: redemonstration of an infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm.addendum will be issued when complete reconstructions have been performed.complete measurements and volumes can be accessed on the aaa reporting tool in careweb.redemonstration of extensive emphysema, with a new spiculated nodule in the right upper lobe and interval resolution of additional previously seen spiculated nodules.an enlarged right hilar lymph node is stable.

text: mediastinal lymphadenopathy has progressed.an enlarged right paratracheal node measures 29 x 27 mm in axial dimensions (2:20), compared to 23 x 15 mm previously.bilateral hilar and subcarinal lymphadenopathy have also progressed.coronary artery calcifications are present.a new low-density right pleural effusion with associated atelectasis, small in size, is also noted, but there is no pericardial effusion.multiple bilateral lung nodules are larger than on the prior study.the largest is in the right upper lobe and measures 19 x 16 mm in axial dimensions, compared to 15 x 11 mm previously (2:28).
summary: progression of metastatic disease.stable mixed lytic and sclerotic lesion in the right posterior ninth rib with a non-aggressive appearance.

text: compared to the most recent prior chest ct of ___, there is near complete regression of diffuse ground-glass opacities and areas of consolidation.there is remnant scarring in the lung apices, which is more prominent on the left where there are also bronchiectatic changes.some peripheral peribronchiolar opacities in the right upper lobe, right lower lobe, and to a lesser extent the left lower lobe are all remnant from preexisting opacities.no area of new consolidation is seen.diffuse irregularity of the airways is suggestive of subtle chronic airway disease, with areas of bronchiectasis also noted in the lung bases.small densities adherent to the lateral upper and lower tracheal wall were not present previously and likely represent secretions.no pleural effusion is seen.no mediastinal, hilar or axillary adenopathy is noted.atherosclerotic calcifications are again noted in the aorta and also coronary arteries.otherwise, the heart and great vessels appear normal.no pericardial effusion is noted.small hiatal hernia is unchanged.while the current study is not designed for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis, again noted are small paraaortic retroperitoneal lymph nodes with an infrarenal conglomerate measuring approximately 30 x 12 mm, similar in appearance with the prior ct torso of ___.incidental note is made of accessory right renal artery.surgical clips are noted in the left axillary region.no region of bony destruction is seen concerning for malignancy.
summary: there is marked improvement compared to ___, with near total regression of ground-glass opacities and regions of consolidation, which were diffuse.there is remnant scarring in the lung apices, most prominently on the left where there is also bronchiectasis.small peripheral peribronchiolar opacities are remnants of preexisting presumed infectious process.no new consolidation, pleural effusion or adenopathy is noted.preexisting airway changes are as before.

text: the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are unremarkable.a few scattered coarse calcifications are noted in the ap window.there is no mediastinal, hilar or axillary lymph adenopathy.there are three pleural-based nodules in the posterior right lung, each measuring approximately 6 x 10 mm.the two more inferiorly abut each other and are unchanged when compared to the prior study.there is also a pleural-based calcific focus in the lateral left mid-lung.there are no intra-pulmonary nodules or masses and no consolidations.the airways are patent through the segmental level bilaterally and there are no pleural effusions.
summary: no evidence of progression of metastatic carcinoid predominantly involving the liver, spleen, and bones.a few pleural-based nodules are noted in the lungs, one of which demonstrates calcification.these may represent ...? prior ...granulomatous disease.interval surveillance is suggested.

text: the thyroid gland has a 5-mm nodule in the left lobe, unchanged.there is no axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy by ct size criteria.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.no pericardial effusion is present.there are mild coronary artery calcifications.the lungs show mild biapical scarring with granulomas noted in the right upper lobe.two right lower lobe nodules (3b:132 measuring 3 mm and 3b:127 measuring 2 mm) are unchanged compared to the previous examination.no new nodules are noted.note is made of a fat containing bochdalek hernia.no effusions or consolidations are present.
summary: interval decrease in the size of fluid collections around segment v of the liver.5 x 10 mm hyperdense cyst in the upper pole of the left kidney has enhancement characteristics concerning for malignancy.differential includes papillary renal cell carcinoma, oncocytoma and an angiomyolipoma with minimal fat.an mri is recommended for further evaluation.mild hip osteoarthritis.mild sacroiliac joint arthritis and grade 1 anterolisthesis of l4 on l5 and l5 on s1.

text: emphysema is moderate-to-severe in the lung apices milder elsewhere.a relatively homogeneous, moderately enhancing region of dense lung in the right middle lobe, extending from the mediastinal pleural surface along the right heart border to the major fissure and diaphragmatic pleural surface is new since ___, but as shown on chest radiographs, developed between ___ and ___.it is more likely pneumonia than either pulmonary infarction or malignancy.several, other smaller regions of heterogeneous peribronchial opacification in the lingula and in the left lower lobe are also most likely infectious.three morphologically different lesions in the anterior segment of the left upper lobe are more radiodense, sharply circumscribed peribronchial distribution, all in the anterior segment, 3:14, 15, and 22.at least one of these lesions is identifiable on the conventional chest radiograph ___, may have enlarged on ___, and was absent on ___.although morphologically these could be metastases, the rapid onset as well as accompanying areas of peribronchial ground-glass opacification in the same axial levels in the posterior segment of the upper lobe, 3:20-24, suggest infection as well.it is possible that these any of these represent a rapidly growing malignancy or, under the appropriate circumstances, lymphoma.central lymph nodes are numerous, though not particularly large, ranging in diameter up to 9 mm in the left lower paratracheal, 6 mm in the right upper paratracheal, 6 mm in the prevascular and 11 mm in the subcarinal stations of the mediastinum and 7 mm in the left hilus.there is no pleural or pericardial abnormality.upper abdominal drains noted in the anterior torso and liver, but this study is not designed for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis.atherosclerotic plaque is heavy at the origin of the left subclavian artery and in the aortic annulus.the aorta is not dilated.
summary: multifocal lung lesions developed between ___ and ___, unlikely to represent metastatic malignancy.differential diagnosis includes infectious pneumonia, alternatively cryptogenic organizing pneumonia and lymphoma or, if patient has had an organ transplant, post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder.atherosclerotic calcification, involving left main and anterior descending and circumflex coronary arteries and left subclavian artery.

text: the main airways are patent to the segmental level.there is right lower lobe consolidation, with air bronchograms, consistent with pneumonia.fluid tracking along the right middle fissure.patchy infiltrate superior to the dominant area of consolidation, likely also a component of the infectious process.fluid tracking along the major fissure as well.atelectasis at the base.the right lung is otherwise clear.the left lung is essentially clear with mild atelectasis at the base.there is no evidence to suggest significant interstitial lung disease.there are no pathologically enlarged axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymph nodes.the heart and pericardium are unremarkable.a right-sided ij catheter is in place.there is no evidence to suggest a mass obstructing the right lower lobe bronchus.contrast bolus is not adequate to evaluate for pulmonary embolus, however, there is no evidence of major central embolus.limited evaluation of the upper abdomen demonstrates no abnormalities.the gallbladder is distended but demonstrates no evidence of stones or other signs to suggest cholecystitis.
summary: right lower lobe pneumonia.no evidence of obstructing mass.no evidence to suggest interstitial lung disease.

text: the patient is post-sternotomy and aortic valve replacement.cardiomegaly, appearance of the aortic valve, and coronary artery calcifications are stable.although the eight sternal wires are in the midline, there is greater than expected widening at the sternotomy site to 11 mm (2:9).moreover, there is increased presternal and retrosternal soft tissue stranding, with small foci of fluid both in the presternal space at the first sternal wire (2:10), as well as in the retrosternal location between the third and fourth sternal wires (2:16).at the areas of greatest soft tissue inflammation/fluid, the medial cortex of the sternotomy site is indistinct.a tiny locule of gas is seen in the anterior mediastinum (4:68).these findings are slightly increased since the study from four days ago from ___ hospital, and not expected over one month postoperative.the remainder of the mediastinum and is unremarkable, with likely pulsation artifact causing focal apparent widening of the pulmonary arteries (2:22).evaluation of the trachea and bronchi reveals that they are patent, but the right lower lobe demonstrates airspace opacification concerning for pneumonia.there is mild subsegmental atelectasis at the left lung base.there is a persistent 6 mm focal pleural thickening adjacent to the right 3rd lateral rib with soft tissue attenuation (4:67).the upper abdomen is partially imaged, and appears unremarkable.osseous structures elsewhere appear unremarkable.
summary: active sternal infection and mediastinitis, with foci of gas and fluid in presternal and retrosternal spaces, with possible sternal osteomyelitis.combination of right lower lobe atelectasis and likely pneumonia; smaller degree of subsegmental left lung base atelectasis.persistent 6 mm focal pleural thickening adjacent to the right 3rd lateral rib, for which 3 month followup ct recommended to exclude growing neoplasm.dr.___ discussed findings #___ with ___ ___ pa the evening of the study; dr.___ discussed #3 with ___ ___ 3pm ___.

text: the right upper lobe pulmonary lesion has increased in size to 12 mm x 11 mm (3:24), previously 10 x 9 mm on ___.the conglomerate of left lower lobe pulmonary nodule has increased in size, remains difficult to accurately measure, but measures in total approximately 27 mm x15 mm (3:34), previously 24 mm x 11 mm on ___.no new pulmonary masses or nodules are identified.there is no pleural effusion or pericardial effusion.there is no mediastinal, axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.bilateral breast implants are again noted.the heart and great vessels appear normal.
summary: interval increase in size of the right upper lobe pulmonary nodule and left lower lobe conglomerate of pulmonary nodules from ___.unchanged hypoattenuating interpolar right kidney lesion from ___ ___.no findings of metastatic disease in the abdomen or pelvis.

text: the aorta opacifies normally without evidence of dissection.the pulmonary arteries opacify normally without intraluminal filling defects to suggest pulmonary embolism.the heart is normal in size.a new pericardial effusion is moderate in severity, causing straightening of the ventricular septum and distortion and attenuation of the right atrium, concerning for tamponade physiology.no pericardial nodularity is identified.multiple mediastinal lymph nodes are new or enlarged including a 14-mm lower right paratracheal lymph node which is new.numerous non-pathologically enlarged upper paratracheal and thoracic inlet lymph nodes are new.a right hilar lymph node is mildly enlarged measuring 11 mm, previously measuring 9 mm.previously identified pleural thickening and nodularity have rapidly progressed within the right hemithorax with numerous new pleural metastases identified and involving both the minor and major fissure.several areas of loculated pleural fluid are noted, most prominent along the paramediastinal pleural surface and within the major and minor fissures.a new left pleural effusion is moderate in severity.no pleural thickening or nodularity is noted within the left hemithorax.right lower lobe airspace consolidation is attributed to atelectasis.multiple new pulmonary nodules are identified including a 6-mm left lower lobe nodule (400b:36), a 3-mm right lower lobe nodule (3:52), a ground glass 9-mm nodule in the right upper lobe (3:39), a 4-mm right upper lobe nodule (3:34) and a 4-mm right upper lobe nodule, consistent with pulmonary metastases.there are no bony lesions suspicious for malignancy.multilevel degenerative changes noted throughout the spine.although the study was not designed for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, numerous low-density lesions within the liver have increased in size, most consistent with worsening hepatic metastases.findings are better characterized on prior ct abdomen dated ___.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.moderate pericardial fluid causing attenuation and distortion of the right atrium, concerning for tamponade physiology.clinical correlation is essential, as reported in preliminary ___ on ___ and discussed with dr.___ at 12:10 a.m.by dr.___.marked interval progression of extensive pleural metastases in the right hemithorax, bilateral pulmonary nodules and mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy, all of which is consistent with worsening metastatic disease.moderate left pleural effusion; no pleural nodules.partially imaged numerous low-density lesions in the liver, demonstrating interval increase in size.

text: the patient has undergone prior right upper lobe wedge resection and a nodular soft tissue component at this site is unchanged in appearance.adjacent to an area of bullous change in the right lower lobe, there is a persistent inhomogeneous nodular opacity which is on today's examination measures 14 mm.comparison to similar slices from the previous examination demonstrates that this is unchanged in size.there is, however, questionable increased density within the posterior aspect of this opacity.there is a stable 3- mm left lower lobe pulmonary nodule (4:19) and 4-mm left upper lobe pulmonary nodule (3:23).filling defects in the pulmonary arteries have now resolved.again identified are atherosclerotic calcifications of the aortic arch and coronary arteries.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.the airways are patent to the segmental level bilaterally.limited views of the abdomen demonstrate fatty infiltration of the liver and unchanged appearance of the adrenal glands.two right axillary lymph nodes have increased in size compared to the prior examination measuring 11 mm.in addition, there is a 14-mm fluid attenuation subareolar lesion just inferior to an area of skin thickening.this may represent a cyst although it is not fully characterized.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: equivocal increased density within the right lower lobe nodular opacity.a slow growing malignancy cannot be excluded.three-month followup chest ct is recommended.right subareolar cystic lesion with accompanying skin thickening.correlate with clinical examination.

text: there has been marked progression of disease with a large mass invading the mediastinum that now significantly narrows and deviates of the trachea above the carina.irregularity of the wall of the trachea above the carina also suggests possible invasion.this mass extends through the right lung apex and encases the subclavian vessels on the right.this mass measures 9.7 x 7.5 cm in greatest dimension on today's examination.(6 x 5 cm on the prior examination).this mass now demonstrates increased invasion of mediastinal structures with deviation of esophagus and soft tissue density surrounding the right main stem bronchus and the lateral margin of the svc.mass like nodular pleural thickening extends along the right upper pleural space posteriorly.there is a new small right- sided pleural effusion.within the right lung, there is a new septal thickening and peribronchovascular thickening that is concerning for lymphangitic carcinomatosis.no pulmonary parenchymal consolidation or pneumothorax are seen.a nodule within the left lung apex appears stable.within limited views of the upper abdomen, a large mass within segment one of the liver has increased in size when compared to the prior examination.another mass within segment ii also demonstrates increased size.large infiltrating renal masses have also increased.a small left adrenal lesion appears unchanged.the spleen is within normal limits.bone destruction suggestive of metastatic disease is identified at the level of t1.similar bone destruction is seen at of the t10 vertebral body on the left.
summary: marked progression of disease when compared to ___ with a large mass invading the right aspect of the mediastinum and causing severe narrowing of the distal trachea with possible endotracheal involvement.this large mass now invades a greater portion of the mediastinum encasing the lateral aspect of the svc and the esophagus.extension through the right lung apex with encasement of the subclavian vessels is also seen.associated mass like nodular thickening of the pleura within the right posterior pleural space and a new small right-sided pleural effusion are seen, consistent with pleural mets.increased thickening of the bronchovascular bundle and interlobular septae within the right lung base and right upper lobe that are concerning for lymphangitic carcinomatosis.progression of intra-abdominal metastatic disease with increased size of multiple hepatic and bilateral renal masses.stable left adrenal lesion.bone destruction of the t1 vertebral body that is increased when compared to the prior examination as well as slightly increased bone destruction of the t10 vertebral body.comparison with an mri of the spine performed the same day is advised for further evaluation of potential involvement of the spinal canal.these findings were called immediately to dr.___ ___ at the time of interpretation.

text: as seen on the ct neck of ___, there is extensive subcutaneous emphysema mostly along the left neck, dissecting along several fascial planes including around strap muscles and sternocleidomastoid, and penetrating as deeply as to the origin of the left subclavian artery.however, there is no evidence of vascular damage.the aorta measures 43 mm near the root.there are aortic vascular and coronary vascular calcifications.a large left pneumothorax is identified.there is some atelectasis at the posterior aspect of the left lung, with a tiny left pleural effusion that measures simple fluid.a left lingular 10 mm opacity is seen.a single lead pacer is identified, originating from the left.the right lung is clear.there is no mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.no axillary lymphadenopathy is identified.no fractures are seen.limited views of the abdomen show a large left parapelvic cyst measuring 22 x 35 mm in greatest axial dimension, with fluid attenuation.bilateral adrenal fullness with peripheral enhancement, 30 x 14 mm on the right, 10 x 23 mm on the left.multiplanar reformats were essential in delineating the findings above.
summary: large left pneumothorax.extensive subcutaneous emphysema in the left anterior neck, without evidence of vascular injury.10mm left lingular opacity which may represent atelectasis vs nodule.followup in 1 month recommended to document stability or resolution.bilateral adrenal nodules which are concerning for metastases.adrenal- protocol ct recommended to evaluate adrenals and to evaluate the remainder of the abdomen/pelvis, as no previous studies are available for comparison.preliminary findings were discussed with dr.___ at time of image acquisition.revised findings regarding the left lung and the adrenal nodules were discussed with dr ___ by phone at 8:15 pm on ___.

text: the pulmonary arteries are well opacified up to subsegmental levels, without evidence of acute pulmonary embolism.there is a hypodense lesion centered in the right major fissure (40:43) measuring 10.2 (ap) x 8.7 (si) x 6.7 cm (tr) dimensions.there is no significant change in the attenuation values prior to and after administration of contrast (approximately 28).this could represent a necrotic tumor versus a loculated fluid collection, which is difficult to differentiate in this study without prior comparisons.bilateral apical pleural parenchymal scarring is noted.scattered paraseptal and centrilobular emphysema seen in both lungs.the major airways are patent to the subsegmental levels.scattered mediastinal lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for significant adenopathy.the largest right paratracheal lymph node measures 8 mm.scattered atherosclerotic calcification is seen in the thoracic aorta and coronary arteries.there is no pericardial effusion.scattered epicardial lymph nodes measuring up to 8 mm are seen (40:77).
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism or acute aortic pathology.hypodense non-enhancing lesion within the right upper lobe is most consistent with necrotic tumor, a complex, loculated fluid collection seems less likely.comparison with prior imaging studies would be helpful.small right and moderate left pleural effusions.hypoenhancing pancreatic head mass, encasing the superior mesenteric vein and causing complete occlusion/ thrombosis of the main portal vein.atrophy of the pancreatic body and tail.the findings are consistent with pancreatic adenocarcinoma.peripancreatic lymphadenopathy involving the common hepatic and superior mesenteric chains, concerning for metastatic disease.small amount of intra-abdominal free fluid.no acute bowel pathology.

text: the soft tissue window images reveal stable appearance of multiple enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes.these are present in the ap window prevascular and precarinal region.the largest one measures 1.5 cm and is seen in the precarinal region.there is no significant hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy.there are multiple filling defects seen in the segmental and subsegmental branches of the right middle and lower as well as left upper and lower lobes consistent with pulmonary emboli.the heart, pericardium and aorta are unremarkable.a small left- sided pleural effusion is present.the soft tissue window images reveal bilateral moderate consolidations at the lung bases.additionally, patchy opacities are visualized at both lung bases.there is some prominence of interstitial markings at the lung bases, likely representing pulmonary edema along with some ground-glass opacities.few opacities are also visualized in the left upper lobe.in the imaged portion of the upper abdomen, the visualized portion of the liver, spleen, adrenals and kidneys appear unremarkable.an endotracheal tube is present with its tip about 6 cm above the carina.there are no suspicious lytic or blastic lesion in the osseous structures.
summary: multiple bilateral pulmonary emboli.moderate bilateral consolidations as well as patchy opacities at the lung bases.prominence of interstitial markings at the lung bases, likely representing pulmonary edema.

text: the thyroid gland is normal in appearance.the major airways are patent down to the subsegmental level.there is no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymphadenopathy.the heart is normal in appearance without pericardial effusion.no nodule, opacity, or effusion present within the lungs.no abnormalities are noted in the soft tissues of the thorax.
summary: large left anterior abdominal wall soft tissue tumor with enhancement pattern consistent with a desmoid tumor.there is no continuity of this lesion with the adjacent ribs.the left inferior epigastric vessels course through this lesion.there is a smaller soft tissue lesion in the left anterior abdominal wall which is superior to the lesion previously mentioned, located just inferior to the anterior sixth rib.this lesion does not have the enhancement pattern of the other desmoid tumor and may represent a region of focal rectus hypertrophy or a small desmoid tumor.cholelithiasis without cholecystitis.significant diverticulosis of the ascending and transverse colon without evidence of diverticulitis.enlarged fibroid uterus.

text: current study is compared to prior study of ___.previously described pulmonary nodules are not definitely visualized on the current study other than the left upper lobe lesion (series 2, image 28), which is unchanged.there are scattered mediastinal lymph nodes, unchanged and none meeting pathologic size criteria.the largest is an ap window node which currently measures 15 mm, similar to the prior exam.there is no hilar or axillary adenopathy.the heart shows minor coronary artery calcifications, otherwise unremarkable.the pulmonary vasculature appears normal, no filling defects.thyroid appears unremarkable.
summary: compared to prior study of ___: 1.no change compared to the prior exam, no evidence of recurrent or metastatic disease.2.no change in left upper lobe pulmonary nodule, other previously described nodules are not visualized at present.3.multiple unchanged chronic changes including diverticulosis, mild coronary artery calcification, prostatic prominence with some bladder wall thickening, l5 sclerotic area, degenerative disc disease changes, probable single gallstone vs.2-mm polyp.

text: the heart, paracardium, and great vessels are normal.there are multiple small non-pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the aorticopulmonary window, and precarinal regions of the mediastinum.there is no hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy.the airways are patent to the segmental bronchi bilaterally.there are bibasilar consolidations posteriorly, slightly increased on the left since the prior study.there is also patchy pulmonary opacification adjacent to a right upper rib fracture consistent with contusion.there are small bilateral dependently layering pleural effusions which do not show evidence of loculation and there are no enhancing margins.there is a small collection measuring 2.6 x 2.3 cm posterior to the sternomanubrial junction with ___ of 45.there are osseous fragments in this region and this likely represents contained hemorrhage.there are fractures of the left second through seventh ribs and the right second rib with associated hemorrhage within the soft tissues.there is no evidence of pneumothorax.
summary: small bilateral pleural effusions with no evidence of empyema.bibasilar consolidations, left greater than right, which could represent contusion vs.aspiration vs.infection.there is also evidence of contusion associated with the right second rib fracture.multiple rib fractures and pelvic fractures as described.large hematoma in the left deep pelvis, little changed.

text: there is a saddle pulmonary embolism extending into the bilateral lobar and segemntal pulmonary arterial branches.other than minimal atherosclerotic calcification the thoracic aorta is unremarkable with no evidence of acute aortic pathology.there is mild enlargement of the right atrium and reflux of contrast within the hepatic veins.there is no axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy.the tracheobronchial tree is patent to the subsegmental levels.the lungs are clear with no focal consolidations, pulmonary nodules or pleural effusions.there is no pneumothorax.this examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.visualized upper abdomen appears unremarkable.
summary: extensive pulmonary embolism with a saddle emboli.possible mild right heart strain.

text: no central or segmental filling defects are identified within the pulmonary arteries to suggest embolism.the pulmonary artery is enlarged, measuring 3.7 cm in diameter, suggestive of pulmonary arterial hypertension.the heart is enlarged.there is no pericardial effusion.the central airways are patent.there is no pathologic lymphadenopathy.the lungs demonstrate lower lobe atelectasis with small bilateral pleural effusions.there is a 4mm peripheral non-calcified pulmonary nodule in the right middle lobe (3:39).there is no abnormality identified, particularly in the right infrahilar region, the area of concern on the chest x-ray -- the findings on chest radiograph are vascular.non-contrast images of the upper abdomen do not reveal any abnormalities.a central venous catheter is seen terminating in the distal superior vena cava.the osseous structures demonstrate degenerative changes of the spine with a mild right convex thoracic scoliosis.no concerning lytic or sclerotic lesions are seen.
summary: no evidence of central or segmental pulmonary embolism.enlarged main pulmonary artery suggestive of pulmonary arterial hypertension.no abnormalities in the right infrahilar region of concern.there is bibasilar atelectasis and small pleural effusions.4mm rml nodule.follow up in one year in the absence of known malignancy.

text: no evidence of dissection or traumatic injury to the aorta is present.although this study was not performed for evaluation of pulmonary embolism, there is no evidence of acute pe.the heart is grossly unremarkable without pericardial effusion.there is minimal bibasilar atelectasis.the major airways are patent.patient is intubated with normal position of endotracheal tube.air is present within the vascular system of the central vasculature most likely secondary to contrast injection.no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar adenopathy is detected.
summary: no evidence of acute traumatic injury.sigmoid diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis.minimal bibasilar atelectasis.several simple appearing hypodensities on the left kidney too small to adequately characterize.
