text: the thoracic aorta has a normal caliber, with mild calcification, but no dissection.there is no pulmonary embolus, although evaluation of the subsegmental pulmonary arteries and lung parenchyma is limited by motion.coronary artery calcifications are greatest in the left anterior descending coronary artery.aortic annulus calcifications are moderate.the heart is not enlarged.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.there are scattered non-pathologically enlarged aortopulmonary window and paratracheal lymph nodes, in addition to enlarged bilateral hilar and subcarinal lymph nodes which measure up to 20 x 13 mm on the right, 18 x 14 mm on the left, and 23 x 14 mm in the subcarinal region.a hiatal hernia is small.left apical linear scar is partially calcified and extends anterior to the major fissure.there is material in the left main bronchus extending to the lower lobe and multiple segmental branches as well as bronchus intermedius on the right, the right lower lobe bronchus and multiple segmental branches, many of which are bronchiectatic, with bronchial wall thickening.there is associated centrilobular predominant nodular opacity, with a peribronchiolar component as well in the lower lobe.dependent atelectasis is mild.two right middle lobe nodular densities measure 3 mm (3, 58; 3, 66).limited images of the upper abdomen reveal no abnormalities.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolus.lower lobe predominant bronchiectasis, mucoid impaction and centrilobular nodular density, which could all be explained by recurrent aspiration.superimposed bronchopneumonia would have similar features.hilar and mediastinal adenopathy may in part be reactive in nature.left upper lobe calcified scarring and calcified left hilar lymph nodes suggests prior tb or granulomatous disease.these findings were conveyed to dr.___ ___ by dr.___ ___ at approximately 10 a.m.on ___, at which time it was discussed that the patient may benefit from bronchoscopy.

text: the thyroid gland is unremarkable.there is no supraclavicular, axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymph nodes.pacemaker leads are seen.the heart and pericardium are unremarkable.there are multiple areas of patchy ground-glass opacities, for example in the right upper lobe, image 4:21, measuring 3.1 x 1.2 cm as well as the bilateral upper lobes, image 4:35, extending into the lower lobe.there are more conspicuous nodules at the left lung base measuring 6 and 5 mm, image 4:58.these patchy opacities may represent multifocal pneumonia, drug reaction or possible lymphocytic infiltrate.there is no pleural effusion.the airways are patent to the subsegmental levels.
summary: multiple ground-glass opacities in the lungs, which may represent multifocal pneumonia or a drug reaction and less likely possible lymphocytic infiltrate.correlate with clinical symptoms and drug therapy.multiple lymphomatous deposits in the abdomen and pelvis have decreased in size.no new lymphomatous involvement seen.

text: there are patchy airspace opacities within the dependent portions of the right middle, right lower, and left lower lobes.there is a small region of lateral right apical pleural thickening.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.debris/material is noted in the distal trachea at the level of the carina.there are mildly prominent mediastinal lymph nodes measuring up to 1.0 cm in short axis diameter (2:23).the patient is status post aortic valve replacement.there is heterogeneity of the right thyroid lobe, with discrete nodules measuring up to 1.0 cm in size.there are degenerative changes and curvature of the spine.an endotracheal tube is in place.
summary: patchy airspace opacities within the dependent right middle, right lower, and left lower lobe, suspicious for aspiration pneumonia.debris seen in the central airways.trace bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.mildly prominent mediastinal lymph nodes, measuring up to 1.0 cm in short axis diameter.extensive atherosclerotic calcification involving the coronary arteries.moderate hiatal hernia.heterogeneity of the right thyroid gland, with hypodense nodules measuring up to 1.0 cm in size.hypodense, 1.4 cm right renal lesion, does not meet criteria for simple cyst, further evaluation with ultrasound or mri is recommended.dilated pancreatic duct, measuring up to 6 mm in diameter.further evaluation with mrcp is recommended.nondisplaced fractures of the left l2 and l3 transverse processes.pagetoid changes of the l5 vertebral body and the osseous structures of the left hemipelvis.10.colonic diverticulosis.

text: there is no axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.a cardiac vascular stent is present.the heart and great vessels are otherwise unremarkable.lung windows reveal resolution of the large left effusion.a small amount of nodular pleural thickening is present on the left, with some areas of enhancement at the inferior left base.linear opacities consistent with scarring are present within the left lung.a tiny punctate peripheral nodule is present within the left lower lobe (series 3, image 50) likely represent a tiny calcified granuloma.there has been near complete resolution of the patchy opacities previously identified within the right lung.no new areas of opacities or nodules are identified.the incompletely visualized liver, pancreas, spleen, gallbladder, adrenals, and kidneys are unremarkable.
summary: there has been interval resolution of the left complex fluid collection.a small amount of left lung scarring and left nodular pleural thickening is present.there is no evidence of interstitial lung disease.

text: the major airways are patent up to subsegmental levels bilaterally.the lungs are well expanded and clear, without consolidation, suspicious pulmonary nodules or pleural effusions.no significant mediastinal, hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy is detected.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels of the mediastinum are unremarkable.the imaged portion of the thyroid gland is normal.right chest wall port-a-cath is present, with tip at the level of the lower svc.
summary: no acute abnormality identified in the chest, abdomen, and pelvis, to account for the patient's symptoms.non-obstructive right renal calculus.unchanged appearance of the diffuse bone marrow abnormality, consistent with patient's known history of multiple myeloma.

text: this is a technically limited study secondary to the patient's inability to hold her breath during image aquisition.soft tissue windows, however, show no definite intraluminal arterial filling defects.evaluation of the segmental and subsegmental pulmonary arterial branches within the left lower lobe is limited secondary to the adjacent atelectasis and dense consolidation of lung tissue.the heart and pericardium are unremarkable.multiple sub-cm, bilateral hilar and axillary lymph nodes are seen.lung windows show dense consolidation with air bronchograms and a small pleural effusion within the left lower lobe.there is adjacent linear atelectasis as well as right basilar atelectasis.the lungs appear otherwise clear.bone windows show no osseous abnormalities.multiplanar reconstruction images confirm the above findings.
summary: no definite intraarterial filling defects seen.left lower lobe pneumonia.tiny associated pleural effusion.right basilar atelectasis.the above findings were discussed with dr.___ at the time of the examination.

text: there are no filling defects in the main or segmental pulmonary arteries to suggest pulmonary embolism.the aorta is unremarkable, without evidence of dissection.patient is intubated, with et tube appropriately positioned.the ng tube terminates in the body of the stomach, with sideports located at the level of ge junction.there is no pericardial effusion.in the lungs, there are parenchymal opacities in the right upper and right lower lobes, most likely representing multifocal pneumonia.there is an area of opacification at the left base that could represent an area of atelectasis, with possible superimposed pneumonia.patient has had left mastectomy in the interval.subcentimeter lymphatic nodes are seen in the prevascular and left hilar area.there are no pathologically enlarged mediastinal, or axillary or hilar lymphatic nodes.imaged upper abdominal organs are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic dissection.right upper and right lower lobe pneumonia.consolidation in the left lower lobe.sideports of the ng tube located at the level of ge junction.findings were communicated to the eu via dashboard.

text: there is no axillary, hilar or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.diffuse emphysematous changes are noted throughout the lungs.multiple pulmonary nodules are noted throughout the lungs, all of which measure less than 4 mm.they do have a spiculated appearance.a metallic density just inferior to the left main stem bronchus may represent prior surgical intervention.the aorta demonstrates no evidence of intramural hematoma or dissection.the pulmonary arteries opacify normally down to the subsegmental level.the heart appears unremarkable.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.
summary: fusiform abdominal aortic aneurysm extending from the renal artery takeoff to the iliac bifurcation; the aneurysm has eroded into the left renal vein creating arteriovenous fistula between the aorta and left renal vein.no extravascular contrast leak is seen.diffuse emphysematous changes with numerous spiculated 4-mm pulmonary nodules; while the number of nodules is reassuring, the possibility of malignancy cannot be excluded and so a 6- to 12-month followup chest ct is recommended.cholelithiasis without cholecystitis hepatic and renal cysts.these findings were discussed by dr.___ with ___ ___ at 17:30 on ___ via phone.further discussion with vascular surgery consult resident was also had.

text: mild emphysematous changes are noted throughout both lung fields, along with mild scattered subpleural scarring.three small uncalcified nodules are noted, in series 2 images 46, 47 and 28.on image 28, the nodule is a pleural based nodule in the superior portion of the left lower lobe.the nodule on image 47 is just posterior to the left major fissure.the final nodule on series 46 is along the anterior right minor fissure.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.the soft tissue windows demonstrate no filling defects within the pulmonary arteries.the heart is remarkable for what is presumed to be a mitral valve repair.the pericardium and great vessels are unremarkable.there are no pleural effusions.limited images through the upper abdomen are unremarkable.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolus.mild diffuse emphysematous changes and three pleural based nodules.given these findings, we recommend a short-term three month follow-up.either comparison with old films or documentation of full two year stability is recommended.

text: again seen is a mass in the left upper lobe that is larger on the current examination when compared to the pet scan from ___.it currently measures 3.5 x 9.5 cm, on the sagittal projections.when comparing to the coronal images from ___ it currently measures 9.3 cm, having previously measured 7.9 cm.there is now increased extension to the posterior superior chest wall.there is persistent encasement and near total occlusion of the left upper lobe pulmonary artery.there is encasement of the lingula and lower lobe pulmonary arterial branches with increased compression on the lingular branches, however these branches are all patent.the right upper lobe bronchus is totally encased by tumor as seen previously.however, on the current examination the lingular bronchus is also encased and occluded which is new.the previously seen pulmonary nodule in the left upper lobe is slightly larger, now measuring 9 mm, having previously measured 7 mm (3:33).the heart size is slightly enlarged.the aorta is normal in size.the main pulmonary artery is dilated up to 3.2 cm with enlargement of the right main pulmonary artery as well.this likely is due to shunting of flow to the right due to compression on the left pulmonary arteries.no filling defect is seen within the central pulmonary arteries to suggest a pulmonary embolism.there are again seen pleural calcifications.there is a small left pleural effusion.limited evaluation of the upper abdomen demonstrates calcified and noncalcified atherosclerotic plaque involving the aorta and the visualized branching vessels.there is a new 2 x 2 cm left adrenal mass.again seen are bilateral renal cysts, the largest is an exophytic left renal cyst measuring up to 5 cm.no lytic or blastic lesions are seen in the visualized bones.
summary: enlarging left upper lobe mass with persistent occlusion of the left upper lobe pulmonary artery and bronchus with new occlusion of the lingular bronchus.new left adrenal mass concerning for metastasis.no evidence for pulmonary embolism.

text: the lung windows reveal a moderate degree of emphysema within a predominantly subpleural distribution within the upper lobes bilaterally.subtle ground glass opacities are noted along the posterior aspect of the left upper lobe peripherally.in addition, a second subtle region of ground-glass opacity is noted along the anteromedial aspect of the left upper lobe.there is a small left pleural effusion associated with partial collapse of the left lower lobe.a smaller right pleural effusion is associated with minimal atelectasis at the right lung base.the airways appear patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.extensive coronary artery calcifications are noted.the heart size is within upper limits of normal.the pericardium and great vessels are unremarkable.there are two apparent filling defect within subsegmental pulmonary arteries supplying the right lower lobe.no central pulmonary emboli.scattered sub- cm aortic window and paratracheal lymph nodes are noted that do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.there is no axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.there are extensive calcifications along the tracheal and bronchial tree.in the imaged portion of the upper abdomen, limited views of the liver and spleen are unremarkable.the osseous windows demonstrate extensive degenerative changes along the thoracic spine.
summary: no evidence of central pulmonary embolus.there are two possible filling defects within subsegmental pulmonary arteries supplying the right lower lone.given the suboptimal bolus & extensive artifact from the tracheo- branchial tree calcifications, these are not entirely diagnostic findings.bilateral small pleural effusions, left greater than right.the left pleural effusion is associated with significant atelectasis/partial collapse of the left lower lobe.moderate emphysema.the ground glass opacities in the posterior and anterior left upper lobe may represent a developing or resolving infectious/inflammatory process.

text: there is extensive left lower and upper lobe atelectasis with additional areas of atelectasis at the right base.the patient is currently intubated with endotracheal tube approximately 2 cm above the carina.a ___ tube is in place within the esophagus with balloon and tip within the stomach.the heart size is normal.the mediastinum appears intact.no pericardial effusion is seen.no pneumothorax is identified.no lymphadenopathy is seen.within the imaged portions of the neck, heterogeneous, expansile soft tissue density is suggestive of a small hematoma (2:16).the trachea appears slightly deviated to the right.within the abdomen, the liver is heterogeneous and markedly enlarged, particularly within the right lobe which has significantly progressed from the prior examination of ___.this is compatible with progression of known hepatocellular carcinoma.heterogeneous material is noted within the portal vein extending to the superior smv which is dilated.this appears somewhat progressed from the prior examination and likely represents tumor thrombus extension.there is a large amount of ascites, which is significantly progressed from ___.the gallbladder appears to be thickened and a large amount of ascites.distal loops of large bowel and rectum are fluid filled, however, appear nondilated.multiple varices are noted including hemorrhoidal and retroperitoneal varices.no evidence of pneumatosis is seen.relative wall thickening of the ascending colon and hepatic flexure could indicate congestion.a foley catheter is within the bladder.
summary: left lower lobe collapse with left upper lobe and right basilar atelectasis.significant progression of known hepatocellular carcinoma, which now involves the entire right hepatic lobe and large areas of the left lobe.portal vein thrombosis, extending to the superior mesenteric vein.extensive varices compatible with given history of gi bleed.markedly increased ascites.thickening of the bowel wall of the ascending colon and hepatic flexure suggestive of vascular congestion.left neck hematoma.

text: the patient has undergone prior right upper lobectomy.there are persistent radiation changes involving the medial aspect of the right apex.note is again made of a right apical lung nodule as well as a stable linear opacity at the periphery of the right lower lobe, both of which appear stable in the interval.there is a pleural-based left lower lobe opacity which is unchanged.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.mucous secretions are present within the right main stem bronchus.there is no significant mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.
summary: stable appearance of the chest.right ureteral stone is no longer present.

text: there are no pulmonary embolisms.the pulmonary artery is enlarged measuring 3.4 cm in diameter and is larger than the aorta.in addition, the heart is enlarged with enlarged atria bilaterally.the right ventricle is also larger than the left ventricle, although this has not changed in appearance since ___.there is no intraventricular bowing of the septum.pleural effusions have worsened since ___ with the right larger than the left.atelectasis of the lower lobes is also significant.again noted are numerous metastatic pulmonary nodules, diffusely scattered.septal thickening is consistent with fluid overload.a large multinodular thyroid gland abuts the esophagus.visualized portions of the upper abdomen demonstrate a large hiatal hernia.a large soft tissue mass abuts the left lateral portion of t10.the hepatic cyst seen in the dome of the liver is unchanged.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.large pulmonary artery measuring 3.4 cm, greater than the aorta.the heart is enlarged with large atria bilaterally, right ventricle greater than the left, although this has not changed in appearance since ___.septal thickening consistent with fluid overload.large pleural effusions, right greater than left, much worse than in ___.significant right and left lower lobe atelectasis.numerous metastatic pulmonary nodules as before.hiatal hernia.these findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ shortly after review on ___.

text: there is moderate-to-severe cardiomegaly.the pulmonary artery is enlarged measuring 3.9 cm consistent with pulmonary arterial hypertension.there is some evidence for right heart strain including bowing of the intraventricular septum.there are no filling defects within the main pulmonary artery or its branches to suggest pulmonary emboli.coronary artery calcifications are present.extensive mediastinal lymphadenopathy is similar in appearance.for example, there is a 13 x 10 mm prevascular lymph node (3, 21).right hilar lymph nodes are also identified, although direct comparison from prior exam is difficult due to lack of iv contrast on previous ct.there is a 13 x 13 mm right hilar lymph node (3, 62) and a 17 x 19 mm lymph node (3, 40).there is a 6-mm pulmonary nodule in the left upper lung (2, 18) which is stable.although this technique was not optimized to evaluate patient's known interstitial lung disease, there is extensive fibrosis, traction bronchiectasis and evidence of honey-combing as seen on prior exam consistent with given history of uip/ipf.allowing for differences in technique, the underlying fibrotic lung disease has not significantly changed.there is diffusely increased density of both lungs suggestive of possible "ground glass opacity" although determination of this entity cannot be made on this non-hrct scan.this increased density could be due to superimposed edema, infection or acute exacerbation of fibrotic process.the thyroid gland contains a hypodense nodule measuring approximately 5 mm, unchanged.punctate calcification in the left lobe of the thyroid gland is also noted.there is a large hiatal hernia, unchanged.the left lobe of the liver contains a subcentimeter hypodense lesion (3, 78) which is too small to characterize but stable.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolus.moderate-to-severe pulmonary arterial hypertension with evidence of right heart strain.similar appearance of extensive fibrotic disease with uip/ipf features.diffusely increased lung density cannot be adequately evaluated with this non-high-resolution ct technique, although could represent pulmonary edema, infection or acute exacerbation of fibrotic process.stable left upper lobe 6-mm nodule.large hiatal hernia.thyroid nodule, stable.compression fracture, stable.subcentimeter liver hypodensity, which is too small to characterize, stable.

text: a pacemaker overlies the left upper chest, with wires appropriately positioned.there is no pericardial effusion.there are very small bilateral pleural effusion.coronary artery calcifications involve lad, left circumflex and right coronary artery.there is moderately severe atherosclerotic calcification of the aortic arch.density in the subcarinal station is likely related to fluid in a pericardial recess rather than an enlarged lymph node (2:30).no other potential mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy is seen.there is no axillary adenopathy.a peripherally calcified fat-containing structure in the imaged left breast may represent an oil cyst (2:20).lung windows demonstrate mild interlobular septal thickening at the extreme lung bases, possibly related to fluid overload.a 5-mm nodular opacity is seen in the peripheral right upper lobe (4:80).other sub 5 mm nodular opacities are seen elsewhere, including in the left upper lobe (4:66, 68, 93 and 112).these nodules are all quite peripheral and nonspecific.a calcified granuloma abuts the right atrium (2:30).the central airways are patent to the subsegmental level.the exam is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis.two metallic biliary stents are noted, with internal soft tissue density, predominating in one of the stents.there is pneumobilia and intrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation throughout the liver, most dramatic in the left lobe.the imaged portion of the spleen demonstrates multiple calcified granulomas.the imaged pancreatic tail and adrenal glands are unremarkable.
summary: there are a few scattered peripheral lung nodules as described, with the largest of which measures 5 mm in the right upper lobe.these findings are nonspecific, in comparison to outside hospital examinations would be helpful to evaluate for interval change.density in the subcarinal station may represent fluid in a pericardial recess versus an enlarged lymph node.there are extensive coronary artery calcifications.small bilateral pleural effusions and mild intralobular septal thickening at the lung bases may raise the possibility of very mild fluid overload.calcified granuloma in the lung and several in the spleen are consistent with prior granulomatous exposure.incompletely evaluated biliary ductal dilatation and biliary stents related to the patient's known cholangiocarcinoma.

text: an endotracheal tube is appropriately positioned.a nasogastric tube courses into the stomach.aside from mild coronary artery calcifications, the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there are no enlarged mediastinal or axillary lymph nodes.there are small pleural effusions with associated compressive atelectasis.
summary: l3-4 osteomyelitis as before.fluid collection in the left psoas muscle with extension into the left internal oblique, external oblique and transversus abdominis muscles.fluid collection within the fascia of the left flank.wall thickening of the transverse and descending colon.findings are could represent ischemic change or inflammatory/infectious etiology.coronary artery calcifications.findings discussed with dr.___ on ___.

text: the previously demonstrated small fluid collection in the left breast is not visualized in the current study.suture material is again demonstrated at the right upper lobe consistent with recent right upper lobe resection with evidence of scarring in this area, not significantly changed compared to the prior study.no new pulmonary nodules are identified.there are no areas of parenchymal consolidation.there is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion.the airways appear patent to the level of segmental bronchi bilaterally.there is a new 1.5 mm right hilar lymph node.no other pathologically enlarged axillary, mediastinal, or hilar nodes are identified.the great vessels, heart, and pericardium are unremarkable.
summary: new 1.5 cm right hilar lymph node, given the patient's history of malignancy, concerning for metastatic disease.

text: the patient is status post lingular sparing left upper lobectomy with expected postoperative appearance of the left hilus.there are no pathologically enlarged axillary, mediastinal, or hilar lymph nodes.the esophagus is distended and filled with air and fluid with transition point at the level of the aortic arch and distal decompression, similar in appearance compared to ___.there are extensive atherosclerotic calcifications of the aorta and aortic branches, coronary artery calcifications, and foci of left pleural calcification.obliquely oriented region of tiny nodules, ground glass opacity, and peribronchiolar thickening in the right posterosuperior lung is slightly increased in size compared to ___ with stable inferior component (3:17) measuring 14 mm and new superior component measuring 9 x 10 mm (3:15).because the major fissure is incomplete at this level it is difficult to determine if this is present in the posterior segment of the right upper lobe or in the superior segment of the left lower lobe.no other pulmonary nodules or masses are identified.diffuse severe emphysematous changes of the lungs are again seen.left pleural fluid has decreased.in the left superior pleural space, an air- filled cavity is now present, previously completely fluid filled.images of the upper abdomen show bilateral stable adrenal lesions, previously characterized as adenomas and a stable 10 mm hypodense lesion in segment ii/iii of the liver.bone windows reveal degenerative changes with no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: slowly increasing focal abnormality in the right postero-superior lung may represent indolent infection or neoplasm.air-filled cavity in the left superior hemithorax is consistent with a persistent pleural space and may suggest some connection with the bronchial tree.stable bilateral adrenal adenomas.stable 10 mm hypodense liver lesion in segment ii/iii.

text: thyroid gland is normal in appearance.aorta and major branches are patent with normal-appearing three-vessel arch.patient is status post ascending aortic aneurysm replacement with graft noted.surrounding soft tissue density predominantly in the anterior and right lateral sides is seen and likely postoperative in nature.surgical clips are noted in the mediastinum as well.there is no pericardial effusion.the heart and pericardium otherwise appear normal.the trachea and central airways are patent to the segmental level.the lungs are clear without focal opacity, nodule, or effusion.the esophagus is normal.there is no supraclavicular, axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.though this study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, limited view of the upper abdomen demonstrates incompletely assessed bilateral upper pole renal cysts.
summary: status post ascending aortic replacement with graft appearing unremarkable with surrounding post-surgical change.mild proximal descending aortic ectasia to 4.1 cm.

text: soft tissue windows show no significant axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymph node enlargement.the heart is enlarged and exhibits coronary calcifications.intrathoracic great vessels are unremarkable.there is a small left-sided pleural effusion.ng tube and et tube are in appropriate position.lung windows show left lower lobe collapse associated with shift of the mediastinum to the left.there is a small area of parenchymal consolidation in the lateral right middle lobe associated with a small pocket of loculated pleural fluid.dependent atelectasis is seen in the posterior right lower lobe.there are no pulmonary nodules.airways appear patent to the level of the segmenatal bronchi bilaterally.visualized upper abdomen shows calcified granuloma in the posterior right liver lobe.the spleen is enlarged.no gallbladder is identified, and correlation with h/o cholecystectomy is necessary.imaged areas of the pancreas, stomach, bowel, kidneys, adrenal glands and intraabdominal great vessels show no abnormalities.osseous structures show degenerative changes and scoliosis of the spine.
summary: left lower lobe collapse and consolidation as previously seen by chest radiograph.no endobronchial lesion is identified.there is an associated small pleural effusion.small area of parenchymal consolidation in the right middle lobe adjacent to small pocket of loculated pleural fluid.cardiomegaly with coronary calcifications.splenomegaly.

text: aside from mild subsegmental dependent atelectasis, the lungs are clear.the airways are patent to the subsegmental levels.there has been a marked reduction in the extent of clot burden compared to ___, with a small quantity of residual thrombus in the proximal left lower lobar and left lower segmental pulmonary arteries.additional clot is seen in the anterior left upper lobar artery.there is no definite evidence of acute pulmonary embolism to the subsegmental levels.persistent enlargement of the main pulmonary artery is noted with a maximal diameter of 3.7 cm.compared with ___, there has been resolution of leftward bowing of the intraventricular septum, indicating decreased/resolved right heart strain.no pericardial effusion is seen.there are no pleural effusions.no pneumothorax is seen.there are no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the mediastinum, hila, or axillae.this study was not optimized for evaluation of the abdominal organs.the visualized portions of the abdomen are unremarkable aside from a small hiatal hernia.
summary: marked reduction in the degree of pulmonary arterial clot burden compared to ___, with small residual clots in the left upper and lower lobe as above.decreased/resolved right heart strain compared to ___.persistent enlargement of the main pulmonary artery suggests a component of pulmonary hypertension.

text: medial left basilar pleural-based opacity consistent with atelectasis has decreased from ___.otherwisse, dependent laterally, left basilar atelectasis has increased slightly, but remains mild.there is no pleural effusion or pericardial effusion.there is no evidence of pulmonary abscess or consolidation.the airways are patent bilaterally to subsegmental level.filling defects in right lower lobe segmental bronchi (2:46) are consistent with pulmonary emboli.the thrombus burden has decreased in comparison to the prior study.no left pulmonary emboli are identified.there is no mediastinal, hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy.there are no concerning osseous lesions.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary abscess or pneumonia.markedly decreased thrombus burden in the pulmonary arteries, with a small amount of residual right lower lobe segmental pulmonary embolus.

text: within the right upper lobe is an irregular spiculated 9 mm nodule not present on ___.this may represent focal inflammation but the differential includes metastasis.close followup is advised.in the apex of the left lung is an ill-defined 7 mm pulmonary nodule, roughly unchanged from ___.a new small irregular 8mm ground glass nodule is also present anteriorly in the left upper lobe (3:19).attention to this area on the subsequent followup is advised.right lower lobe atelectasis/scarring is present.the patient is status post esophagectomy with gastric pull-up.prevascular lymph node has decreased in size today measuring 4 x 12 mm.note is made of a precarinal lymph node measuring 5 mm in short axis, though not pathologically enlarged.small amount of postoperative fluid is present in the mediastinum.no pathologic axillary adenopathy is identified.
summary: new ill-defined 8 mm spiculated right upper lobe lesion and other ground glass nodules may represent focal atelectasis, inflammation, but metastases must also be considered.close followup (3- months) is recommended.status post gastric-pull through for esophagus resection.findings emailed to dr.___ ___.

text: the bilobed nodular opacity in the right upper lobe, as measured on thin section images, has at one level increased its maximum diameter from 5.3 to 7.2 mm (4:39), and the greatest diameter of the bilobed portion has increased from 7.5 to 8.6 mm.these small changes are not definitive for growth, but they do suggest it.two subsolid opacities in the posterior basal segment of the left lower lobe (3:39 and 40) are stable since ___, but using the high collimation images for comparison, the more anterior of the two (4:157) has grown from 4 mm in diameter on ___, to 5.5 mm today.heterogeneous ground-glass opacification in the right middle lobe is probably due to incomplete expansion following right upper lobe surgery.a very dense 2 mm left lower lobe subpleural nodule (3:37) is stable since at least ___.right upper paratracheal mediastinal lymph node is stable at 9 mm in diameter and there is no pathologic enlargement of lymph nodes elsewhere in the mediastinum or in the hila.borderline hilar nodal enlargement is mild and unchanged.heterogeneous enlargement of the right lobe of the thyroid gland has increased since ___, from 26 x 37 mm to 26 x 41 mm deflecting the trachea to the left reproducing a stable degree of mild narrowing of the sagittal diameter.a heterogeneous nodule in the lateral limb of the left adrenal gland, which measured 20 x 14 mm on ___, is 19 x 13 mm today.the spleen is moderately enlarged and unchanged and multiple low- density lesions in the liver, some with heavy vascular enhancement at the periphery, attributed to multiple hemangiomas, are all unchanged since ___.small right pleural effusion has decreased since ___.
summary: slight growth since ___, in bilobed subcentimeter right upper lobe nodule and since ___, in subcentimeter left lower lobe subsolid nodule could be malignant.no evidence of recurrence, following right upper lobe resection.no lymphadenopathy.decreased small right pleural effusion.a 2 cm left adrenal mass, stable since at least ___, presumably benign.growing right thyroid goiter.a benign etiology cannot be assured, although it is most likely.mild stable axillary adenopathy and splenomegaly.multiple hepatic hemangiomas, unchanged.

text: soft tissue windows show no significant axillary, mediastinal or hilar lymph node enlargement.heart and intrathoracic great vessels are within normal limits.no pericardial or pleural effusions are seen.lung windows show two areas of patchy ground glass opacities in the right upper lobe.linear opacity at the right lung base is suggestive of scarring.tiny pulmonary nodule in the right middle lobe is nonspecific in appearance.there are no other pulmonary nodules or masses.the airways appear patent to the level of subsegmental bronchi bilaterally.
summary: areas of ground glass opacity in the right upper lobe could be infectious or inflammatory in nature.tiny pulmonary nodule in the right middle lobe is nonspecific in appearance.linear opacity at the right lung base is suggestive of parenchymal scarring.multiple low attenuation foci in the liver are too small to characterize.small calcification in the region of the cbd could represent a tiny ductal stone.there is no dilatation of the intrahepatic biliary tree or pancreatic duct.gallbladder is normal.dense areas in the kidneys cannot be fully assessed for enhancement.they could represent hyperdense cysts.surgical changes in the anterior abdominal wall and left pelvis.

text: a right chest port is noted along with left chest two-lead pacer with leads in unchanged position.no lower cervical adenopathy.thyroid gland is unremarkable in appearance.there is a four-vessel aortic arch.there has been interval decrease in mediastinal adenopathy with prevascular lymph node previously measuring 12 x 22 mm, currently 6 x 9 mm.pretracheal lymph node previously measured 1.9 x 2.2 cm, currently measures 1.0 x 1.7 cm.right hilar node previously measured 1.7 x 1.5 cm, currently measures 2.0 x 2.3 cm.subcarinal node previously measured 2.9 x 1.4 cm, currently measures 1.6 x 0.9 cm.heart size, particularly the left ventricle, is mildly enlarged.there has been interval decrease in size of left primary lung mass along the left major fissure which previously measured 3.3 x 3.4 cm, currently measures 2.9 x 1.8 cm.the large area of associated ground-glass opacity and nodularity is markedly improved from comparison; however, there has been interval development of numerous additional pulmonary nodules including a 6-mm nodule in the left lower lobe apical segment, with surrounding ground-glass opacity (2:14), a 9-mm lingular nodule (2:31), a 1.8 x 3.2 cm mass in the right middle lobe (2:40) with numerous additional smaller nodules in the right middle lobe.a 1.6 x 0.8 cm right lower lobe nodule (2:38), as well as additional smaller nodules in the right lower lobe.the 11 mm liver lesion noted in segment ii (2:48) is stable from comparison.there is a new 6 mm hypodensity in the right hepatic lobe, segment vi (2:76), which remains suspicious.normal appearance of the gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, adrenals and kidneys with stable 12-mm left simple cyst.the small and large bowel are unobstructed without focal bowel wall thickening.pelvic organs are within normal limits for size.an ivc filter is noted with superior tip at the level of the renal arteries and inferiorly there is non-occlusive thrombus.atherosclerotic changes of the aorta are noted without aneurysm or dissection.incidental note of separate origin of the left gastric artery from the celiac trunk.there is a new 4-mm sclerotic focus in the left posterior iliac bone.no other suspicious osseous lesions are identified.
summary: mixed response to therapy with overall progression of disease.numerous new lung nodules and a mass in the right middle lobe as described above as well as suspicious new lesions in the left iliac bone and right hepatic lobe.at the same time, there has also been a decrease in the primary mass as well as mediastinal adenopathy.nonocclusive thrombus inferior to the ivc filter in the inferior vena cava.

text: the patient has undergone prior sternotomy and cabg, with sternal plates for wound dehiscence.there has been interval improvement in inflammatory changes and stranding in the subcutaneous tissues overlying the sternal plates.soft tissue material surrounding the sternal plates and within the retrosternal soft tissues is stable.there is no focal fluid collection or new abnormality.there is no abnormal enhancement.the heart size is normal.there is no pericardial effusion.calcified coronary arteries are noted.the great vessels are unremarkable.multiple lymph nodes in the mediastinum and hila do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.the largest measures 9 mm just above the carina (2:18).there is no axillary lymphadenopathy by size criteria.lungs are clear without consolidation or pleural effusion.there has been interval improvement in right upper lobe centrilobular opacities.a calcified granuloma in the right upper lobe is unchanged.the tracheobronchial tree is patent to subsegmental levels.while this exam is not optimized for assessment of the abdomen, there is no acute abnormalities in the upper abdomen.
summary: stable appearance of sternal plating, with no new collection or evidence of infection.nondisplaced fractures in anterior right ribs 6 through 8, new since ___, but demonstrating evidence of healing.interval improvement in right upper lobe centrilobular opacities, with no evidence of new consolidation or infection.findings of multiple rib fractures discussed with dr.___ ___ at 5:10pm ___.

text: there is interval increase in size of the left-sided lung mass demonstrating near total occlusion of the left main pulmonary artery and partial encroachment upon the main pulmonary and right main pulmonary arteries.there is increasing involvement of the mediastinum of this heterogeneous mass now demonstrating near total encasement of the left subclavian and left common carotid arteries with encroachment upon the innominate artery.there is extensive mediastinal lymphadenopathy.the lung mass produces compression of, and alteration of the contour of the trachea in addition to encasement and total segmental occlusion of the left main stem bronchus with partial aeration of the left-sided airway more distally.there is near total collapse of the left lung.no evidence of pulmonary embolism.lung windows demonstrate diffuse ground-glass opacity affecting patchy areas of the left lung and the majority of the right lung.interlobular septal thickening is also noted.there are bilateral pleural effusions.the heart is unchanged compared to the prior study.an endotracheal tube is in place.the esophagus is partially fluid filled.bone windows demonstrate no suspicious lytic or sclerotic foci with no definite invasion of the ribs adjacent to the large left-sided lung mass.
summary: interval increase in size of large left-sided lung mass producing near total occlusion of the left main pulmonary artery while encroaching upon the main pulmonary artery and right main pulmonary arteries, also compressing the trachea and producing near total occlusion of the left main stem bronchus.there is increasing encasement also of the left subclavian and left common carotid arteries.no evidence of pulmonary embolism.mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy.bilateral pleural effusions with interlobular septal thickening and diffuse lung parenchymal ground-glass opacity most consistent with pulmonary edema.other considerations include atypical infection or drug hypersensitivity reaction.

text: the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no significant mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.again noted is a right lower lobe nodule with a cystic appearance, which remains unchanged from the prior exam.there is interval development of diffuse nodular opacity bilaterally.the above nodules are somewhat ill-defined, and appear more prominent in the right lower lobe and left lower lobe.also noted is fibrotic change of the medial aspects of the left lung and right lung, which are most likely due to post radiation changes.
summary: ill-defined nodular pattern predominantly in the right lower lobe and left lower lobe, and the differential diagnosis includes viral infection, fungal infection, and pulmonary tb; pulmonary metastatic disease is less likely.interval increase in size and number of innumerable metastatic lesions in the liver.

text: there is marked pulmonary edema in the dependent lungs with relatively small bilateral pleural effusions.it has a consolidative appearance in the left lower and right upper lobes.there is underlying emphysema.the central airways appear patent.there is an endotracheal tube appropriately positioned within the trachea.though incompletely imaged on the images submitted, there is no evidence of acute aortic syndrome of the thorax.the abdominal aorta measures at least 3.7cm in the imaged portion.the heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion.there are no pathologically enlarged hilar, mediastinal, or axillary lymph nodes.the pulmonary arteries are patent to the subsegmental level.numerous hypodensities within the liver are not fully evaluated.the left adrenal is prominent measuring 12 mm.no concerning osseous lesions are seen.
summary: no pulmonary embolus.severe pulmonary edema which with left lower and right upper lobar consolidation.likely pneumonia resulting in edema.3.7 cm suprarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm, incompletely imaged.findings were discussed with dr.___ at 4:15 a.m.

text: fat stranding and locules of gas are noted in the right axillary/subpectoral region from recent surgery.remaining right axillary and subpectoral nodes measure 15-17 mm.contiguous disease infiltration is noted involving the right pectoralis major, with stranding and soft tissue nodularity.again seen is extensive mediastinal and hilar adenopathy with a heterogeneously hypoenhancing appearance, compatible with lymphoma.this conglomerate mediastinal mass encases and partly compresses the epicardium, pulmonary arteries, and bronchi.pericardial thickening anteriorly.there is evidence of peribronchovascular spread, with irregular nodules extending along the bronchovascular bundles.endotracheal tube remains 1.7 cm from the carina.there are multiple areas of peripheral bronchial narrowing and obstruction.note is made of a focal region of saccular bronchiectasis in the anterior segment of the right lower lobe.diffuse pulmonary opacities have progressed, most severe in the upper and lower lobes, with a heterogeneous and consolidative appearance.there has been interval increase in a large right pleural effusion that circumferentially encases and compresses the entire lung ("drowned lung" appearance).new small left pleural effusion has also developed.the heart is normal in size, without pericardial effusion or right heart strain.pulmonary arteries are diffusely narrowed, but there is no evidence of pulmonary embolus to the proximal segmental levels.thoracic aorta is normal in caliber throughout.examination is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.known osseous metastases are better appreciated on pet-ct.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.diffuse mediastinal lymphadenopathy, with epicardial and bronchovascular encasement.increased bilateral pulmonary opacities, likely representing post-obstructive pneumonitis/aspiration, atelectasis, infection, and/or hemorrhage.increased right and new left pleural effusions.right axillary/subpectoral lymphadenopathy and postoperative changes.

text: there are no filling defects to suggest pulmonary embolism.additionally, there are no secondary signs of pulmonary embolism, including no evidence of right- sided heart strain.no central chronic pulmonary embolism is seen.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable, and there is no evidence for pericardial or pleural effusion.small calcified subcarinal and right hilar lymph nodes represent prior granulomatous exposure with scattered small calcified lung granulomas also noted.1.8 cm right and 1.5 cm left thyroid hypodensities are unchanged iin the short interval.there is a small axial hiatal hernia, unchanged in appearance.a 1.3 x 1.2 cm lingular nodule is again unchanged.no new focal consolidation or mass is identified.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.mild lower lobe bronchiectasis is noted bilaterally.although this exam is not tailored to evaluate abdominal organs, limited evaluation of the upper abdomen is unremarkable.multilevel thoracic spondylosis is noted.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.stable size of lingular pulmonary nodule since ___.hypodense thyroid nodules again warrant further evaluation with ultrasound on a non-emergent basis.small axial hiatal hernia.

text: the thyroid gland is unremarkable.there is no axillary lymphadenopathy by ct size criteria.multiple enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes are noted, including the prevascular space measuring up to 9 mm, the right paratracheal space measuring up to 1.2 cm.the pulmonary arteries are patent down to the subsegmental level.the aorta is normal in caliber throughout.the heart is unremarkable.a small pericardial effusion is present.note is made of mild coronary artery calcifications.the patient is status post esophagectomy with an esophageal stent noted to be in good position.evaluation for recurrence is limited due to postoperative change from the recently placed stent.the lungs show diffuse interlobular septal thickening in both upper lobes with mild ground glass opacities in both lungs, likely representing mild-to-moderate pulmonary edema.also noted is bronchial wall thickening that is likely secondary to edema as well.the right lower lobe is collapsed with narrowing of the right lower lobe bronchus and possible mucus plugging.there are small to moderate bilateral effusions.mild right middle lobe atelectasis is noted with a loculated right middle lobe effusion.a right lower lobe nodule measures 6 mm, which previously measured 5 mm on ___, ___.no other nodules are noted.a left-sided picc is noted.although this examination was not intended for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, the partially imaged abdomen is unremarkable.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.moderate bilateral pulmonary edema.lower lobe atelectasis.small bilateral lower lobe effusions and small loculated right middle lobe effusion.mediastinal lymphadenopathy.small pericardial effusion.

text: there is no evidence of thoracic aortic dissection.there is no filling defect within the pulmonary arterial branches to suggest pulmonary embolism.since the prior study, the left main stem bronchial stent has been removed, and a y-shaped tracheal stent extending into both main stem bronchi has been placed.however, the right main stem bronchial limb extends only a very short distance into of the right main stem bronchus, and the posterior aspect of this limb is not in contact with the bronchial structures or the esophageal stent.there is air situated between the two stents representing a remnant fistulous connection.there is opacification of the orifices of the right posterior and posterolateral segmental bronchi, and there is patchy airspace opacity throughout the right lower lobe, and the lateral portion of the right middle lobe, consistent with aspiration pneumonia.there has been interim placement of an esophageal stent, extending from just superior to the origin of the great vessels, to the mid portion of the left atrium.a fluid level is seen layering posteriorly, within the esophageal stent.there is mild-to-moderate circumferential thickening of the esophagus just inferior to the level of the stent.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.mediastinal lymph nodes appear relatively similar compared to the prior study.one large right paratracheal lymph node is seen on series 3, image 18, currently measuring 17 x 16 mm, and previously measuring 17 x 17 mm.a second large lymph node is seen within the aorticopulmonary window, on series 3, image 45, measuring 17 x 11 mm.this structure previously measured similarly.again, marked soft tissue thickening around the main stem bronchi is appreciated.the left-sided bronchi are well aerated on the current study.a confluent area of consolidation is again seen within the superior segment of the left lower lobe, not significantly changed.mild emphysema is again appreciated.radiation changes within the anterior chest are again seen.within the superior portion of the upper abdomen, visualized portions of the liver, spleen, and adrenal glands are normal.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism or thoracic aortic dissection.aspiration pneumonia involving the right lower lobe and the lateral segment of the right middle lobe.there is opacification of the airways of the right lower lobe proximally.interim placement of y-shaped tracheal stent and esophageal stent.the right limb of the tracheal stent extends approximately 1.5 cm into the right mainstem bronchus; however, the tracheal stent incompletely covers the fistulous connection.fluid level within the esophageal stent, likely predisposing to aspiration.unchanged lymph nodes within the chest.

text: no incidental thyroid findings.no supraclavicular, infraclavicular, or axillary lymphadenopathy.normal postoperative appearance of the retrosternal area, no evidence of lymphadenopathy or fluid collections.no precarinal or pericardial lymphadenopathy.no enlarged lymph nodes in the posterior mediastinum.no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusions.normal post-surgical appearance of the heart with coronary calcifications, and staples post-cabg.normal appearance of the spleen, small splenule (3, 62).punctate calcification the left liver (3, 63).the displayed parts of the kidneys and of the pancreas are unremarkable.unremarkable gallbladder.mild bilateral apical centrilobular emphysema.non-characteristic scars at the bases of the lingula and the middle lobe.minimal airway wall thickening and irregularities, consistent with chronic airways disease.no lung nodules or masses.the airways are patent without evidence of intrabronchial lesions.the sternal wires are in correct position.there is no evidence of sternal disjunction or rupture of sternal wires.no evidence of sternal osteomyelitis.mild degenerative vertebral changes in the thoracic spine.no other bony abnormalities.
summary: no evidence of sternal disjunction, sternal wire displacement or rupture, or sternal osteomyelitis.unremarkable findings after cabg.mild centrilobular emphysema.mild chronic airways disease.no pericardial or pleural effusions.

text: there is a large heterogeneous 4.4 x 3.7 cm mass with spiculated margins along the right minor fissure, involving the inferior aspect of the right upper lobe and superior aspect of the right middle lobe; this mass is highly concerning for bronchogenic carcinoma.the mass abuts and tethers the pleura, which is slightly thickened, however, there is no definite evidence of pleural invasion.there is no pleural effusion.the ribs in this region are normal.the right middle lobe artery traverses the mass without significant narrowing.there is a small pulmonary embolus within the anterior segment of the right lower lobe artery (4:185).there are satellite nodules in the right middle lobe measuring 7, 5 and 4 mm each (4:174, 187 and 205 respectively).there is also an 8-mm ovoid nodule in the right lower lobe (4:227).there are two 12-mm right hilar nodes, a 16-mm subcarinal node, 11- mm precarinal node, and 21 x 16 mm right paratracheal lymph node conglomerate (2:21).smaller left hilar nodes measure up to 7 mm (2:30).there is also a small prevascular node measuring up to 4 mm in short axis.severe apical predominant emphysema is present.the heart is mildly enlarged and there is moderate calcification within the lad.mitral and aortic annuli are calcified.there is extensive calcified and soft plaque within the aorta, particularly at the aortic arch as well as moderate narrowing of the left subclavian artery.atherosclerotic plaque in the upper abdominal aorta is also extensive and there is minimal opacification of the left renal artery with a subsequently atrophic left kidney.there are no concerning hepatic lesions.diffuse thickening of the left adrenal gland is consistent with hyperplasia, with no focal nodule.the right adrenal gland is normal.there is a small axial hiatal hernia.diverticulosis of the splenic flexure is noted.there are no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: large heterogeneous mass in the right upper and middle lobes with associated hilar and mediastinal lymphadenopathy, highly concerning for bronchogenic carcinoma.no pleural effusion or chest wall invasion.additional pulmonary nodules in the right middle and lower lobes, measuring up to 8 mm each.small segmental pulmonary embolus within the anterior segment of the right lower lobe pulmonary artery.extensive atherosclerotic disease within the aorta and moderate calcification in the lad.moderately severe centrilobular emphysema.left adrenal hyperplasia without focal nodule.these findings were discussed by dr.___ ___ with dr.___ at 9:00 p.m.on ___.jr

text: no filling defect is identified within the central and segmental pulmonary arteries.respiratory motion limits evaluation of the subsegmental pulmonary arteries, specifically within the right lower lobe.thoracic aorta maintains a normal contour without evidence of dissection.multiple mildly enlarged mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes are present, which are not appreciably changed compared to prior exam.the heart size is within normal limits.calcified and noncalcified atheromatous plaque is seen at the origin of the great vessels.no pleural or pericardial effusion is detected.again identified are cavitary lesions at the lung apices with nodular soft tissue lesions centrally consistent with aspergilloma.the lung adjacent to these cavities shows architectural distortion, traction bronchiectasis and peribronchial thickening.a cluster of ___ mm nodules are seen in the left upper lobe inferior to the cavitary lesion, unchanged.mild centrilobular emphysema is noted.limited views of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.subacute posterior right eleventh rib fracture is noted.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolus within the central and segmental pulmonary arteries.stable biapical intracavitary lesions likely due to aspergilloma.stable mediastinal lymphadenopathy.new subacute right posterior eleventh rib fracture.resolution of previously described peribronchovascular opacity in the left lower lobe/lingula.

text: on soft tissue window images, there is heterogeneous enlargement of the right lobe of the thyroid gland.a small thyroid cyst is also present in the right lobe.there are multiple nonpathologically enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes.no hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy is seen.again seen are aortic and mitral valve prostheses.a pacemaker is implanted in the right anterior chest wall with a lead visualized in the right ventricle.coronary artery and vascular calcifications are again seen.several calcified mediastinal lymph nodes are again seen and unchanged.the lung window images demonstrate several small pulmonary nodules, one of which is calcified in the right upper lobe, and these are unchanged in comparison to previous study.the previous findings of bronchitis/bronchopneuonia are again seen, including left lower lobe opacities, thickening of the interlobular septa, and bronchial wall thickening.there has been some interval reduction in the fluid layering within the right and left mainstem bronchi.no pleural effusions are seen.the airways are patent to the level of the segmental bronchi bilaterally.
summary: large 7.5 x 4 x 7.4 cm soft tissue mass in the right flank between the transversus and internal oblique muscle of the abdominal wall.given it's appearance, its most likely a post- traumatic hematoma.retrospectively, this was on the prior study, and appears unchanged.if this does not clinically resolve within 6 weeks, follow up imaging with mri is recommended.2 .previously noted findings including peribronchial opacities and tree-and- ___ pattern in the left lower lobe are again seen, consistent with bronchitis or bronchial pneumonia and are unchanged since previous exam.there has been interval improvement in fluid layering noted in the mainstem bronchi.no interval change in the previously noted small pulmonary nodules and calcified mediastinal lymph nodes, which represent possible prior chronic granulomatous infection.previously noted enlargement of the right lobe of the thyroid is also unchanged.

text: the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no evidence of aortic injury.there is no mediastinal hematoma.tiny foci of air in the epicardial fat (2, 40) is identified and may represent a small pneumomediastinum.there is a small right pneumothorax with a tiny hemorrhagic effusion on the right.bibasilar consolidations likely represent contusions versus aspiration.there is no axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.a prominent right hilar lymph node is identified, not meeting ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.
summary: small right hemopneumothorax.tiny foci of air within the epicardial fat pad.no evidence of aortic injury.bilateral consolidations which may represent aspiration versus contusions.multiple right-sided rib fractures, right scapular and right clavicular fractures as described above.enhancing liver lesion likely representing a hemangioma.splenic hypodensity, too small to characterize, although small intrasplenic laceration cannot be excluded.no perisplenic fluid identified.findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ and posted to the ed dashboard.

text: since the examination of ___, ___, there has been placement of an endovascular aortic stent graft with its proximal end at the level of the distal aspect of the left subclavian artery, terminating in the distal descending aorta.there is no evidence of contrast extravasation beyond the margins of the graft.the mediastinal hematoma has decreased slightly in size since ___.the left-sided hemothorax has been largely evacuated, and a left-sided chest tube is in place entering via a left intercostal approach, tracking in the major fissure and terminating adjacent to the mediastinum.a small right-sided hydropneumothorax with apical/anterior and posteromedial component is present.a right-sided pleural effusion and adjacent compressive atelectasis have decreased.the heart and pericardium, and central airways appear unremarkable.
summary: status post placement of descending aortic endovascular stent graft without evidence of leak.left-sided hydropneumothorax with marked decrease in hemothorax since ___, and with interval placement of a chest tube.decreased simple right pleural effusion and atelectasis.7 mm enhancing nodule in the pancreatic head most likely represents a hyperenhancing pancreatic mass such as a neuroendocrine tumor.two fat and soft tissue density containing left adrenal lesions consistent with myelolipoma.unchanged hypodense hepatic lesions consistent with cysts.

text: unchanged appearance of multiple low-attenuation thyroid lesions which could reflect multiple thyroid nodules, however, further evaluation with a dedicated ultrasound is recommended.no pathologically significant mediastinal, axillary, or hilar adenopathy is noted.the largest mediastinal lymph node is noted in the precarinal region measuring 5.8 mm in short axis.the lungs are clear.no suspicious pulmonary nodules are noted.there is evidence of left subpleural nodularity, not seen on prior study and could represent focal atelectasis.attention on followup is recommended.the heart and great vessels are normal.there is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.
summary: unchanged multiple hyperenhancing low-attenuation hepatic lesions suggestive of metastatic disease.multiple large low-attenuation thyroid nodules.further evaluation with dedicated ultrasound is recommended.oncology table is created.

text: previously visualized pericarinal lymph node appears unchanged and measures 9 mm in the short axis (3:23) when compared to 9 mm previously.previously visualized large subcarinal lymph node has decreased in size and now measures 24 x 13 mm (3:27) compared to 48 x 35 mm on ___.previously visualized internal mammary lymph node has now increased in size measuring 28 x 21 mm (3:23), in comparison to 25 x 16 mm previously.furthermore, previously visualized right infrahilar lymph node remains stable at 7 mm in diameter (3:33).there are no other paratracheal, hilar, or infrahilar pathologically enlarged lymph nodes.previously visualized large right inferior pleural-based/anterior chest wall mass is now slightly smaller in size measuring 8.0 x 6.4 x 6.0 cm (3:39) compared to 8.7 x 7 x 5.4 cm previously.this mass continues to have some areas of low-to-intermediate attenuation suggestive of internal cystic changes/necrosis.previously visualized heterogeneous enhancing opacity adjacent to this mass possibly representing a stalk/pleural connection is slightly decreased in size, measuring 3.1 x 1.6 cm compared to 3.6 x 2.4 cm previously (3:45).hyperenhancing foci are seen at the periphery of this mass consistent with fiducial markings.there continues to be compression of the right lung with related atelectasis at the right lung base.surgical changes are again noted throughout the left breast.right port-a-cath remains in place.multiple pleural plaques/hyperdensities are again visualized and represent likely calcified pleural plaques due to pleurodesis versus areas of enhancement, remaining stable in comparison to prior study.otherwise, the lungs are clear without evidence of consolidation, effusions, or pneumothorax.the airways are patent to the subsegmental bronchi.no new pulmonary nodules are visualized.
summary: no evidence of new metastatic disease.interval decrease in size of the inferior anterior right chest wall mass as well as marked decrease in size of the previously visualized subcarinal lymph node.slightly larger right internal mammary lymph node.unchanged hepatic, renal, and adrenal masses.

text: there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.there is a left chest wall pacemaker.the patient is status post right pneumonectomy.there is volume loss in the right lung.there is soft tissue density and complex fluid density within the pneumonectomy cavity.the soft tissue density is likely consistent with the muscle flap and the fluid is likely post-surgical in nature.there are several enlarged right paratracheal lymph nodes.these measure 1.3 and 1.6 cm in short axis dimension.these have decreased in size in the interval.on the prior study, these measured 1.8 and 1.7 cm respectively in short axis dimension.no new mediastinal lymphadenopathy is present.there has been resection of the right pulmonary veins and pulmonary arteries.the right mainstem bronchus has been surgically ligated.there is inspissated secretions at the level of the carina and the right mainstem bronchus stump.the trachea and left lung airways are patent down to the subsegmental bronchi.there are sternotomy wires consistent with recent pneumonectomy.there is a moderate-sized left pleural effusion.this pleural effusion appears to be partially loculated.the effusion is increased in comparison to the prior study.there is a band-like parenchymal opacity in the left lower lobe, consistent with atelectasis/scarring.patchy opacity is present along the dependent portions of the left posterior lung, likely consistent with atelectasis.reflux of contrast is seen in the hepatic veins.limited visualization of the upper abdominal organs is unremarkable.there are postsurgical changes and old degenerative changes in the osseous structures.there are no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
summary: postsurgical changes in the right hemithorax.enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes are present which have decreased in size in the interval.these may be reactive in nature but continued attention to these lymph nodes on future examinations is recommended.moderate-sized partially loculated left pleural effusion.patchy and band-like dependent parenchymal opacities in the left lung, likely representative of atelectasis.pericardial effusion.reflux of contrast into the hepatic veins, suggestive of right heart failure.

text: the heart and pericardium are unremarkable, without pericardial effusion.the great vessels are within normal limits, without evidence of an acute vascular injury.no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy is identified.there are multiple left-sided rib fractures, involving the left third through eighth ribs posterolaterally, with the left seventh rib fractured in two places.there is an associated small pneumatocele within the left lower lobe (5:33), with atelectasis of the dependent portions of the lung bases bilaterally.additionally, within the superior segment of the left lower lobe is a more rounded area of consolidation within the lung, likely reflecting a hematoma/contusion.a small left basal and apical pneumothorax is seen.there is no pleural effusion.
summary: multiple left-sided rib fractures, with the left seventh rib fractured in two separate places.pulmonary hematoma/contusion and small pneumatocele in the left lower lobe.small left apical and basal pneumothorax.left scapular comminuted fracture, and mildly displaced left clavicular head fracture.findings were posted to the ed dashboard at time of interpretation.

text: a right internal jugular venous catheter terminates in the distal svc.note is made of narrowing of the right subclavian vein with opacification of multiple collateral veins in the upper right chest wall.aortic, aortic valvular, and coronary artery calcifications are as previously seen.the pulmonary arteries are not well assessed due to timing of contrast bolus, therefore evaluation for pulmonary embolism is not possible.compared to ct of the chest of ___, there is interval resolution of small pericardial effusion as well as bilateral mild- to- moderate pleural effusions.since the ct of the same date, the patient had undergone tracheostomy, the site of which is now capped.debris is noted within the upper trachea, otherwise the remaining airways appear patent.again note is made of moderate upper lobe predominant emphysema.in addition to dependent atelectatic changes, bilateral dependent parenchymal consolidations are mildly improved compared to ct chest of ___.no abscess is seen.compared to images through the lung bases on more recent ct abdomen/pelvis of ___, consolidation in the right lung base is increased but is not changed in the left lung base.these findings are consistent with increased opacity seen in the right lung base on recent chest radiograph, likely due to aspiration.bronchiectasis in the lung bases also are likely due to chronic aspiration or post-inflammatory changes.supraclavicular nodes are subcentimeter in size, as are prevascular nodes.however, note is made of a prominent precarinal node which measures 12 mm in short axis as well as subcarinal nodes which measure up to 15 mm in short axis.limited views through the upper abdomen show a percutaneous gastrostomy in place.bilateral renal cysts are partially visualized.degenerative changes are again noted in the thoracic spine.
summary: bilateral dependent parenchymal consolidations are improved compared to ct chest of ___.since more recent ct abdomen/pelvis of ___, consolidation in the right lung base is slightly increased.together with findings on recent chest radiograph, this is likely due to aspiration.these changes may be followed radiographically.no abscess is seen.interval resolution of bilateral pleural effusions since ___ as well as small pericardial effusion.several prominent mediastinal lymph nodes are slightly larger than that seen on ___ and could represent reactive change.attention to these is recommended on followup studies.upper lobe predominant emphysema.aortic valvular calcifications.narrowed right subclavian vein with opacification of multiple chest wall collaterals.

text: 7 mm precarinal and subcarinal lymph nodes are not significantly changed from the prior study.no nodes of the axillae, mediastinum, or hila meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement.a trace amount of pericardial fluid is stable.there is trace right pleural fluid which appears new from ___.coronary artery calcifications are unchanged, as are calcifications associated with the mitral valve.there is a moderate amount of respiratory motion present.however, ground-glass opacities throughout both lungs are new from the prior exam.more focal ground glass abuts the left major fissure (2:18) measuring about 5 mm.the central airways are patent to the subsegmental level.
summary: three hepatic lesions are similar to the prior study of ___.however, there are multiple vague areas of hypoattenuation throughout the right lobe of liver which are new from the prior study, not optimally defined on this single phase examination.further evaluation with multiphasic mri (or multiphasic ct) is recommended, to exclude the presence of multiple new focal uncharacterized lesions.new ground-glass attenuation throughout both lungs.while some of this finding may be related to respiratory motion and atelectasis, infectious/inflammatory etiologies could be considered.no dense consolidations are present.new healing fracture of the right seventh anterolateral rib.unchanged sclerotic lesions of t3 and l1.findings were relayed to the critical results dashboard, for communication with the ordering physician.

text: no axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy seen.no pleural or pericardial effusion seen.the heart and great vessels are unchanged in appearance compared with the previous study.the previously demonstrated ground-glass opacity at the left base is no longer apparent.no concerning pulmonary nodules seen.
summary: mild persistent splenomegaly.small retroperitoneal lymph nodes, unchanged in appearance compared with the previous study.no cause for the patient's fever is identified on the basis of this study.

text: non-calcified 3-mm nodule in the right upper lobe (3a:23) is less dense.multifocal areas of small airways disease with bronchiolitis and tree-in-___ /centrilobular opacities have improved in the lingula and right lower lobe.left basal posterior consolidation has not significantly changed and is consistent with atelectasis and/or aspiration.there are no new nodules or lung abnormalities.trace of pericardial effusion is stable.there is no pleural effusion.aside from few secretions in the lower trachea, the airways are patent.cardiac size is normal.aorta and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.there are no bone findings of malignancy.multiple calcifications in the uncinate process, head and body of the pancreas are unchanged.gastrojejunostomy tube is in place.visualized portions of the liver, gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys are unremarkable.
summary: overall improvement in multifocal small airways infection/bronchiolitis.atelectasis/consolidation in the left lower lobe has not significantly changed.

text: multiple shoddy lymph nodes are seen within the mediastinum and hila measuring up to approximately 1 cm at the ap window and 1 cm at the right hilum.the node at the ap window has decreased in size from 14 mm on the prior examination, and shows central hypodensity on the current study, possibly related to increasing central necrosis.the 1-cm right hilar lymph node was not evident on the prior examination.the heart and pericardium appear unremarkable.the brachiocephalic artery and left common carotid arise from a single trunk off of the aorta.the left subclavian artery arises conventionally.examination of lung windows demonstrates a significant interval response.left upper lobe nodule (lesion 1) measures 7 x 19 mm (series 3, image 25), which has decreased significantly from the prior measurement of 15 x 20 mm.the lingular lesion 2 measures approximately 9 x 10 mm (series 3, image 36), which has decreased from a previous measurement of 16 x 17 mm.lesion 3, within the posterior costophrenic angle on the left measures approximately 9 x 10 mm (series 3, image 47), and previously 14 x 13 mm.the multiple other pulmonary nodules seen on the prior examination have all decreased in size since the prior study.mild bibasilar atelectasis is present.
summary: significant interval response of multiple pulmonary nodules, with target lesion measurements as above.retrocrural lymphadenopathy minimally changed.borderline fatty infiltration of the liver.dr.___ ___ ___

text: the patient is status post right lower lobe lobectomy and right upper lobe partial segmentectomy.there is a right-sided hydropneumothorax and pneumothorax more anteriorly.there is diffuse subcutaneous emphysema through anterior and posterior fascial planes on the right.contrast bolus timing was adequate for the of subsegmental pulmonary arteries.there is thrombus originating at the site of the ligated right lower lobe pulmonary artery (3:40) with thrombus extending distally into the right middle lobe pulmonary artery (3:41, 500:1).no additional filling defects were seen.there is diffuse honeycombing of both lungs which is new since prior study.the heart and great vessels are normal.there is no pneumopericardium.
summary: status post right lower lobe lobectomy and right upper lobe posterior segmentectomy.acute pulmonary embolism originating at the ligated right lower lobe pulmonary artery extending into the right middle lobe pulmonary artery.diffuse bilateral honeycombing which is new since ___.right hydropneumothorax and pneumothorax.right-sided subcutaneous edema.results were communicated with dr.___ at 11:50 a.m.and with dr.___ at 1:30 p.m.

text: the anterior mediastinal mass measures approximately 3.7 x 5.7 cm and does not appear significantly changed in size when compared to the previous pet/ct; however, the technique used between the two studies (pet/ct is a non-contrast non-breathhold study) is slightly different, which makes exact comparison difficult.the mass partially surrounds the aorta and main pulmonary artery.there are enlarged adjacent left-sided hilar and prevascular nodes.there is an 8-mm right-sided upper paratracheal node and smaller lower right-sided paratracheal nodes.no extension into the chest wall is identified.there is a moderate- to large- sized pericardial effusion, which appears increased in size.there are no pleural effusions bilaterally.note is made of a prominent arterial collateral arising from the celiac axis, likely the inferior phrenic artery, which extends up the anterior left chest wall to supply the region of the tumor.the pulmonary artery appears partially compressed by the tumor but widely patent without evidence of pulmonary emboli.there are tiny, noncalcified nodules within the right lower lobe (series 3, image 22) and the left lower lobe (series 3, image 27).there is atelectasis within the right middle lobe and lingula.limited views of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.
summary: anterior mediastinal mass which partially surrounding the aorta and pulmonary artery with enlarged left hilar lymph nodes appears stable.no chest wall invasion is identified.moderate- to large-sized pericardial effusion, which has increased in size when compared to the previous exam.
