text: there is no thoracic aortic dissection.there are no filling defects within the pulmonary arterial branches to suggest a pulmonary embolism.there are coronary artery calcifications.there is no pericardial effusion.a pacemaker is in place.there may be a sliver of a left pleural effusion present.there is patchy opacity within the left base that may represent a pneumonia or aspiration.there are scattered patchy areas of ground glass in both lungs, which may represent an element of fluid overload.there is a nodular opacity within the right middle lobe (series 3, image 54) measuring 4 mm.the central airways are patent.there is a 7-mm hypodense nodule of the right lobe of the thyroid.no pathologically enlarged axillary lymph nodes.there are scattered mediastinal lymph nodes, which do not meet ct size criteria for pathologic enlargement, measuring up to 8 mm in the short axis.in the right anterior chest wall at the thoracic inlet, there is a small fluid collection measuring 30 x 9 mm with surrounding stranding that may correspond to the patients known line infection.within the imaged portion of the upper abdomen, the liver demonstrates some calcifications, which may represent granulomas.the spleen is enlarged, measuring 17 cm.the previously characterized left adrenal adenoma is again seen.there is a small right adrenal myelolipoma.
summary: no evidence of thoracic aortic dissection or pulmonary embolism.linear fluid collection and stranding in the right upper chest wall consistent with known line infection.consolidation within the left base, which may represent a pneumonia or aspiration.there are patchy areas of ground glass in both lungs, which may reflect fluid overload.coronary artery calcifications, and calcifications of the aorta.splenomegaly.left adrenal adenoma.right adrenal myelolipoma.

text: the patient is status post sternotomy as well as repeat sternotomy for wound dehiscence.multiple sternotomy plates and screws traverse the dehisced sternum.inflammatory changes in the anterior chest wall and retrosternal soft tissues are unchanged from the appearance on the comparison study and there is no fluid or other collection and no evidence of abnormal enhancement.the heart and great vessels are notable for scattered mediastinal lymph nodes, none of which are enlarged by ct size criteria.airways are patent to segmental levels bilaterally.a calcified granuloma in the right upper lobe is unchanged.note is made of bilateral dependent ventilatory changes in the lungs.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.imaged portions of the upper abdomen are unremarkable.osseous structures reveal no suspicious sclerotic or lytic lesions.there is lucency surrounding many of the sternal screws, unchanged from the previous study.
summary: no change from the comparison study with redemonstration of non-specific soft tissue thickening and enhancement adjacent along the sternotomy site.there is no evidence of abnormal enhancement or discrete fluid collection.

text: fractures are seen within the left sixth, seventh and eighth ribs.there is a small associated pleural effusion with high attenuation likely representing hematoma.there is a small left pneumothorax.there is associated small amount of subcutaneous emphysema adjacent to fracture site.the right lung is unremarkable.the mediastinum, great vessels, and heart are normal.there is no pericardial effusion.
summary: multiple left-sided rib fractures.small left pleural effusion, likely hemothorax.small left pneumothorax.splenic laceration, grade 2, with probable extravasation.minimal change in hematoma size on delayed imaging.

text: there is no pulmonary embolism.mediastinal shift to the right is again observed.no pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymph nodes are noted.large left and small right pleural effusions are noted with fissural fluid and associated bibasilar atelectasis.increased interstitial markings bilaterally likely represent a component of pulmonary edema; however, asymmetric right nodular interlobular septal thickening in a polygonal pattern and associated centrilobular nodules raise concern for lymphangitic spread of tumor.bibasilar foci of airspace opacity may represent atelectasis, however focal infectious consolidations cannot be excluded.there is no evidence of pneumothorax.osseous structures appear unchanged compared to ___.again no worrisome lytic or sclerotic lesions are identified.
summary: no pe.asymmetric right-sided nodular interlobular thickening and centrilobular nodules worrisome for unilateral lymphangitic carcinomatosis, which can occur in gastric carcinoma.this is likely in the setting of mild pulmonary edema with large right and small left pleural effusions again seen.these findings are largely new compared to ___.foci of airspace consolidation, also new, may represent atelectasis, however infectious consolidation cannot be excluded.these findings were relayed to the ed via the online wet read dashboard.

text: the study is slightly limited due to the phase of contrast injection.allowing for this, there are no filling defects within the pulmonary artery or proximal branches to suggest the presence of pulmonary embolism.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels are normal in appearance.there is no pleural or pericardial effusion.scattered mediastinal lymph nodes do not meet ct criteria for pathologic enlargement.the largest prevascular lymph node measures 4 mm in short axis.there is no axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.on lung windows, there are no focal areas of consolidation.multiple small calcified granulomas are again seen.multiple small cystic are noted peripherally within the lung apices.these are unchanged since ___.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.partial small bowel obstruction.multiple slightly dilated small bowel loops without a definite transition point.single loop within the left mid abdomen demonstrates inflammatory change and is at the site of prior surgery.new free fluid is seen within the abdomen, extending to the level of the pelvis.interval resolution of large right-sided peritoneal fluid collection.status post total colectomy with hartmann's pouch and right lower quadrant diverting ileostomy.status post cholecystectomy.

text: the pulmonary arteries are well opacified to the subsegmental level.there are filling defects in the segmental and subsegmental pulmonary arteries supplying the right middle lobe, right lower lobe, and the left lower lobe that are consistent with pulmonary emboli.no evidence of right heart strain is seen.there is mixed calcified and soft atherosclerotic plaques within the aorta and the great vessels.the aorta demonstrates normal caliber throughout the thorax without intramural hematoma or dissection.a port-a-cath is seen entering the left subclavian vein and ending in the superior vena cava.coronary artery calcifications are again noted.remainder of the heart is unremarkable.there is a moderate size pericardial effusion.there is no hilar, mediastinal or axillary lymph node enlargement by ct size criteria.the patient is status post esophagectomy with gastric pull-through with an esophagogastric stent in unchanged position.as before, the distal aspect of the stent contains a large amount of food and fluid resulting in near occlusion.there are aerosolized secretions within the trachea and the right and left main bronchi extending to the segmental level.there is continued bronchial wall thickening with thickening along the axial interstitium most severe within the lower lobes, but improved compared to the prior pet-ct.there is interval improvement in diffuse bilateral lower lobe predominant ground-glass opacities with septal thickening, likely reflecting an element of pulmonary edema.persistent right lower lobe consolidation is re-demonstrated, possibly infectious.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, greater on the right than on the left side, that are unchanged compared to the prior study.a transcutaneous pleural catheter is seen ending in the base of the left hemithorax.there is no pneumothorax.in the right lobe of the thyroid, there is a 6-mm hypodense nodule that is unchanged compared to prior exam.within the visualized upper abdomen, bilateral nodularity of the adrenals is unchanged.clips from prior cholecystectomy are partially imaged.
summary: bilateral segmental and subsegmental pulmonary emboli within the right middle lobe and both lower lobes.no evidence of right heart strain.continued right lower lobe consolidation, which again may be infectious, with interval improvement in diffuse bronchial wall thickening and ground-glass opacification, most severe within the lung bases, likely reflecting an element of mild pulmonary edema.airway secretions within the trachea and segmental bronchi.unchanged, small, right greater than left, pleural effusions and moderate sized pericardial effusion.

text: again seen is a large spiculated cavitating mass measuring 4.6 x 4.9 cm (axially) within the right upper lobe (2:15), unchanged in size in comparison to the ___ ct examination, with internal non-enhancement reflecting central necrosis.the mass abuts the posterior-medial pleural space overlying the right 4th rib without obvious osseous extension.no new masses or nodules are detected.there is no pleural effusion.the heart size is normal, there is no pericardial effusion.the great vessels are patent and normal in caliber.no large pulmonary embolus is detected within segment levels.there is no axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.
summary: unchanged appearance of a necrotic right upper lobe cavitary mass in comparison to the ___ examination.a hypodensity within the pancreatic neck appears less distinct in comparison to the ___, likely due to differences in contrast bolus timing, but remains present.as this lesion was fdg avid on the prior pet-ct examination, a separate primary malignancy remains on the differential.

text: endotracheal tube is in place, roughly 3.5 cm above the carina.nasogastric tube is in place with tip coiled in the proximal duodenum.right internal jugular central venous catheter tip terminates in the superior vena cava.there is a left pacemaker, and two intracardiac leads, one which extends into the right atrium, and the second in the right ventricle.post- surgical change is seen with prior median sternotomy, and aortic root repair.though this study is not gated or optimized for evaluation of the intracardiac structures, there is evidence of soft tissue density adjacent to the anterior aspect of the aortic root.there is no pericardial effusion.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, and moderate bibasilar atelectasis, left greater than right.on the left, the small pleural effusion tracks along the major fissure.there is mild biapical pleural/parenchymal scarring.the central airways are patent to the subsegmental level.there are enlarged mediastinal and right hilar lymph nodes measuring up to 1.9 cm in short-axis.
summary: soft tissue density at the anterior aspect of the base of the aortic root may correspond to valvular vegetation seen on recent tee.however, without cardiac gating, ct evaluation is limited by cardiac motion.small bilateral pleural effusions, and moderate bibasilar atelectasis, left greater than right.mediastinal lymphadenopathy.

text: there is a right subclavian central venous catheter terminating at the cavoatrial junction.the aorta and great vessels are intact.there is no cardiomegaly or pericardial effusion.coronary artery calcifications are seen.borderline mediastinal lymphadenopathy measuring up to 11 mm in the subcarinal area has slightly increased in prominence since the prior study.left axillary lymphadenopathy is unchanged.there is no right axillary or hilar lymphadenopathy.there are small, bilateral, non-loculated pleural effusions, not significantly changed in size since the prior study.no pleural enhancement is seen to suggest empyema.there is mild bibasilar subsegmental atelectasis.the lungs are otherwise clear.no areas of infiltrate or consolidation are seen.the patient is now seen to be extubated.the central airways are clear.this study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, only to confirm normal-appearing adrenal glands.the previously seen right paravertebral abscess at the level of the t12-l1 intervertebral disc space has decreased in size, now measuring 2.7 x 1.3 cm.degenerative changes are seen within the spine.no suspicious lytic or blastic lesion is seen.within the subcutaneous soft tissues of the shoulder anteriorly, there is a 6.8 x 2.4 x 4.2 cm rim-enhancing fluid- and gas- containing collection.
summary: small, bilateral, non-loculated pleural effusions, unchanged since the prior study.no evidence of empyema, as clinically questioned.slightly increased prominence of mild mediastinal lymphadenopathy, which could be reactive.fluid and gas-containing collection within the subcutaneous tissues of the anterior shoulder, which may represent an abscess.clinical correlation recommended.adjacent left axillary lymphadenopathy is likely reactive.decreased size of right paravertebral abscess.

text: no dissection flap is present within the thoracic aorta.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.evaluation of the pulmonary parenchyma is limited given respiratory motion, however, no consolidations or pulmonary masses are detected.no axillary, mediastinal, or hilar adenopathy per ct size criteria.the major airways appear patent down to the subsegmental level.there is an axial hiatal hernia with fluid present within the distal esophagus suggesting reflux.
summary: limited study secondary to motion without evidence of acute traumatic injury to the torso.axial hiatal hernia with suggestion of reflux.

text: there is bibasilar peripheral atelectasis seen in the lungs.there is no effusion or pneumothorax.anterior rib fractures are noted of the sternal ribs bilaterally.an endotracheal tube is in place and positioned 3.5 cm from the level of the carina.the heart is normal in size and configuration.the aorta is unremarkable, with incidental note is made of the left vertebral artery originating directly from the arch.the central pulmonary arteries are patent, the central airways are patent.there is no mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymphadenopathy.
summary: no acute findings to explain the patient's decompensation.fatty liver without focal lesions identified.pulmonary atelectasis.

text: soft tissue window images demonstrate prominent mediastinal fat.there are several mediastinal lymph nodes noted, one of which is at the upper limits of normal in the left paratracheal region.there are no pleural or pericardial effusions.minimal dependent atelectasis seen bilaterally.the ng tube is positioned with the tip in the mid esophagus.the et tube is positioned with the tip above the carina.
summary: no intrathoracic or intraabdominal injury is identified.multiple hemangiomas are seen within the liver.

text: there are no pulmonary arterial filling defects to suggest the presence of pulmonary embolism.there is no aortic dissection.there are small bilateral non-hemorrhagic pleural effusions as well as large areas of atelectasis bilaterally.on the left, most of the posterior basal segment is collapsed.there are also multiple areas of airspace consolidation consistent with multifocal pneumonia.there are multiple enlarged lymph nodes within the mediastinum.the largest are a 19 x 12 mm right paratracheal lymph node (3:19) and a 20 x 11 mm paraesophageal lymph node further inferiorly (3:34).severe tracheomalacia is again identified beginning just distal to the endotracheal tube and continuing through the carina (3:10).this is similar in extent and severity to the prior examination from ___.no focal osseous lesions are identified.there is extensive atherosclerotic calcification within the thoracic aorta and coronary arteries.a small pericardial effusion is present, without evidence of tamponade as well as a probable edematous lymph node in the epicardial fat pad (4:112).
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism or acute aortic syndrome.multifocal pneumonia and segmental atelectasis, with small bilateral non-hemorrhagic pleural effusions.severe tracheomalacia.mediastinal lymphadenopathy, likely reactive hypertrophy in the setting of pneumonia.

text: no filling defects are identified within the pulmonary arteries to suggest pulmonary embolus.there is diffuse bronchial plugging and bronchial wall thickening involving the left lower lobe bronchi (3:29; 35 as representative images), with similar but less prominent changes noted in the right lower lobe.diffuse background emphysematous change is again noted.in the right upper lobe, a 5-mm nodule (3:14), is new compared to prior studies.an additional nodule is seen within the superior segment of the right lower lobe measuring 7 mm, also new (3:17).in addition to these nodules, there are numerous nodular densities and areas of interspersed intralobular septal thickening within the lower lobes bilaterally, corresponding to the regions of bronchovascular thickening, which may relate to atypical superimposed infectious process or aspiration.a couple of nodular densities are seen in additional region such as right middle lobe (3:51, 4 mm), and there are milder but similar centrilobular nodular densities in the lingula.calcified pleural plaques are noted suggestive of prior asbestos exposure.the aorta shows atherosclerotic calcification, unchanged.there are no pathologically enlarged mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymph nodes, although a subcarinal node which measures 9 mm is borderline.imaged portion of upper abdomen shows hyperdense material and fiducial markers within the liver consistent with prior treatment with tace and cyberknife.the partly hyperdense treated segment ___ mass is grossly similar in size.segment ii lesion is inadequately imaged on this non-contrast examination.splenic artery calcifications again noted.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolus.diffuse bronchial wall thickening, bronchial fluid and/or mucus plugging involving the bilateral lower lobes, with intralobular septal thickening and centrilobular ground-glass nodular densities in right and left lower lobes and lingula.findings are suggestive of aspiration and/or superimposed atypical infection.new nodules in the right upper and superior segment of right lower lobe measuring 5 and 7 mm are worrisome for metastases in the setting of hepatocellular carcinoma.however, given a possible superimposed infectious process, short-interval followup is recommended with ct within three months.limited imaging of the known treated hcc within the liver.findings consistent with subacute fractures of the right seventh and eighth ribs.emphysema.

text: there is an et tube in place as well as a right picc line ending in the svc.an ng tube is also identified ending in the gastric fundus.the heart and great vessels are intact.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, slightly greater on the right.there is bilateral lower lobe atelectasis as well as mild ground glass changes within the right anterior upper lobe, likely due to atelectasis.incidental note is made of bilateral hypoechoic lesions within the thyroid measuring 11 x 19 mm on the right and 13 x 9 mm on the left.multiple mediastinal lymph nodes are identified, the largest within the ap window measuring up to 8 mm in maximal short axis.however, there is no bulky axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.there is a large amount of stranding as well as multiple fluid collections identified extending from the visualized lower cervical spine to the upper thoracic spine.these collections measure approximately 9.3 x 3.1 cm along the left posterior cervical spine as well as 7.0 x 7.8 cm along the upper thoracic spine.these changes are thought to be most likely post- surgical in nature, although an underlying infectious collection cannot be excluded.
summary: large amount of stranding as well as several fluid collections seen along the posterior spine extending from the lower cervical level to the upper thoracic spine level, likely postoperative in nature.no ct sign of infection, however this cannot be completely excluded by imaging alone.small bilateral pleural effusions, greater on the right with bilateral lower lobe atelectasis.no acute intra-abdominal process.postoperative thoracic spine changes as described.

text: there is new leftward mediastinal shift with near complete left upper lobe collapse with obstruction of bronchus centrally.enlarged left hilar lymph nodes are increased in size as compared to ___, ___.for example, an 8-mm lymph node anterior to the left lower lobe main pulmonary artery (2, 32) is increased in size and demonstrates slight enhancement.similarly, multiple prevascular lymph nodes are also larger since ___.for example, two 6-mm lymph nodes lateral to the aortic arch (2, 23).the left main bronchus demonstrates abrupt tapering with obstruction at the origin of the upper lobe bronchus, raising question of obstructive mass in a patient with known primary squamous cell carcinoma and advanced emphysema.there is also extensive soft tissue thickening along the course of the left main bronchus and left lower lobe bronchus.remainder of the lungs demonstrate severe and predominantly centrilobular emphysema with saber-sheath trachea.diffuse bronchial wall thickening is present bilaterally with foci of mucoid impaction, for example, in the left lower lobe (2, 38).these findings are suggestive of chronic airways disease such as bronchitis.a small left pleural effusion is new since ___.central and segmental airway to the right lung and left lower lobe remain patent.previously described multiple sub-3-mm pulmonary nodules which were stable between ___ and ___ appear unchanged within limitation of severe background emphysema.numerous mediastinal lymph nodes are increased in size as compared to ___.for example, a 9-mm pretracheal lymph node (2, 24), multiple 6 mm prevascular lymph nodes (2, 23), a 9 mm prevascular lymph node (2, 28), a subcarinal 9 mm lymph node, and multiple left hilar lymph nodes as described above.diffuse esophageal wall thickening is present, although esophagus is partially collapsed and not optimally evaluated, suggestive of infectious or inflammatory etiology.a paraesophageal lymph node inferior to the left main bronchus (2, 37) is larger since ___.a small hiatal hernia is noted.the heart is normal in size, with coronary calcifications.atherosclerotic calcifications involve the aortic arch and descending aorta without evidence of aneurysm.there is no significant pericardial effusion.limited subdiaphragmatic evaluation reveals patchy areas of hyperattenuation within the liver, some nodular in appearance in the right lobe, raising question of potential metastatic foci, although these are not fully evaluated.alternatively these could represent perfusion abnormality.the left adrenal gland appears slightly plump but is stable since ___.remainder of visceral organs demonstrate no gross abnormality.healed rib fractures are noted on the left.cervical degenerative disease has progressed since ___.no focal suspicious lytic or blastic osseous lesions.
summary: near complete left upper lobe collapse with narrowing and obstruction of the left upper lobe bronchus and hilar lymphadenopathy, highly concerning for malignant obstruction in a patient with known primary squamous cell carcinoma and advanced emphysema.given diffuse bronchial wall thickening and chronic airways disease in other portions of the lung, this could also reflect endobronchial secretions.further delineation by bronchoscopy is recommended to help distinguish suspected obstructing neoplasm from inflammatory/infectious etiology.incomplete evaluation of heterogeneous areas of hyperattenuation within the liver, some nodular in appearance within the right hepatic lobe, raising question of potential metastatic foci.alternatively, this could represent perfusion abnormality.further assessment with dedicated ct or mri is recommended, especially if the patient proves to have a primary lung cancer.severe emphysema and bronchitis.limited evaluation of sub-3-mm nodules as previously described in ___.visible lesions are stable.findings reported to dr.___ ___ at the time of this dictation.

text: a nodule in the left lobe of thyroid measures 11 x 19 mm (2:2).it is predominantly of low attenuation and noncalcified.there is no pathologic enlargement of the supraclavicular, mediastinal, or axillary lymph nodes.the main pulmonary artery is enlarged (35 mm in transverse dimension) relative to the aorta, which is normal in appearance and caliber.acute pulmonary emboli extend from the distal right and left pulmonary arteries into all lobes, expanding the affected arteries consistent with acute bilateral second order pulmonary emboli.there is associated straightening of the intraventricular septum consistent with elevated right ventricular pressure.there is no pericardial effusion.the central airways are patent.there is no evidence of pericardial or pleural effusion.left lower lobe atelectasis is mild.the study is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation, only to confirm normal appearing adrenals.a schmorl's node at t10 is consistent with degenerative disc disease.
summary: very extensive, acute pulmonary embolism with associated pulmonary arterial and right ventricular hypertension.the results were telephoned to ms.___, clinical team member, at 2035 hours, ___ by dr.___, night float resident.incidental finding of left thyroid nodule, ultrasound evaluation, when clinically appropriate, is suggested.

text: dense multifocal opacities are seen within the right lung and left lung base consistent with multifocal pneumonia.no cavitary lesion is detected.there are small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left.note is made of calcified aortic valve which may suggest aortic stenosis and can correlate with echocardiography if warrented.no filling defect is identified within the pulmonary arteries.there are multiple prominent mediastinal nodes the largest of which is a right paratracheal node measuring 18 x 9 mm.enlarged lymph nodes are also seen within the left axilla, the largest measures 2.0 x 1.2 cm.the left lobe of the thyroid is enlarged and measures 3.0 x 3.5 cm.et tube is present.diffuse atherosclerotic calcification is seen within the aorta and coronaries.visualized upper abdomen demonstrates cholelithiasis.ng tube is curled within the stomach.
summary: multifocal opacities involving the right lung and left lung base consistent with pneumonia.small bilateral pleural effusions.no evidence of cavitation.cholelithiasis.prominent mediastinal and left axillary lymph nodes as described above.calfied aortic valve, which may suggest some degree of aortic stenosis.can correlate with echocardiography is clincally warranted.

text: there are no filling defects within the pulmonary artery and its branches to suggest pulmonary embolus.there is no thoracic aortic dissection.

text: the patient has moderate underlying emphysema.there is a large infiltrative right hilar mass which extends into the mediastinum, particularly the subcarinal station.at the level of the right pulmonary artery, the hilar mass measures 3.1 x 2.9 cm and a subcarinal conglomerate measures 5.1 x 2.1 cm (3:58).at the level of the right pulmonary vein, the subcarinal soft tissue conglomerate measures 4.0 x 3.3 cm (3:62), amputates the inferior right pulmonary vein and causes mass effect on the left atrium which it may invade (3:67).although branches of the right pulmonary artery are narrowed by the infiltrative right hilar mass, they remain patent, with no filling defect seen to suggest pulmonary embolism.right lower lobe segmental bronchi are markedly dilated centrally, with wall thickening, debris and fluid levels.right middle and lower lobe peribronchovascular soft tissue and septal thickening is consistent with lymphangitic carcinomatosis.scattered airspace opacities are also noted in the rll and lul.the right hilar mass causes partial narrowing of right upper lobe (rul) bronchus, with more severe narrowing of the right middle lobe (rml) bronchus.milder lymphangitic carcinomatosis is noted in the rml.bronchiectasis is noted in in the rml, with peribronchiolar nodules and patchy peripheral opacities.small patchy airspace opacities are noted in the left upper lobe (lul), and, to a lesser extent, the rul and the medial left lower lobe (lll).there is small right non-hemorrhagic pleural effusion.no region of bony destruction is seen concerning for malignancy.limited views through the upper abdomen show replaced left hepatic artery, likely arising from the celiac artery.
summary: right hilar mass with extension into mediastinum and with lymphangitic carcinomatosis in rll and rml, consistent with reported history of rll small cell carcinoma.bronchoceles in the rll with wall thickening and containing debris and fluid are consistent with necrotizing bronchiectasis; if the patient has not had radiation therapy, infectious cause would be most suspect.patchy peripheral opacities likely representing infection from aspirated fluid/debris from bronchoceles.right hilar mass causes narrowing of arteries and bronchi, and amputates the right pulmonary vein.no pulmonary embolism seen.findings were initially posted on the ed dashboard upon completion of the study.

text: the vascular structures bilaterally, show no evidence of pulmonary embolism.the lung window images reveal diffuse emphysematous changes bilaterally, with some ground-glass opacities in bilateral upper lobes.within the left upper lobe, there is a 1.6 x 1.3 cm spiculated mass, concerning for a malignancy.soft tissue windows reveal left hilar, peritracheal and mediastinal lymphadenopathy.there is a moderate size right pleural effusion.within the abdomen, the imaged portions of the liver, and spleen are normal in appearance.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.1.6 x 1.3 cm spiculated mass in the posterior aspect of the left upper lobe, concerning for malignancy.left hilar, mediastinal, and peritracheal lymphadenopathy.bilateral emphysematous changes with ground-glass opacities most prominent in bilateral upper lobes.right-sided pleural effusion.

text: small-to-moderate, non-hemorrhagic, largely layering bilateral pleural effusion is new.parietal, costal pleural enhancement is relatively mild.severe heterogeneous consolidation in the left lung has worsened appreciably, and there is now widespread ground-glass opacification and new basal consolidation in the right lung, lower lobe greater than upper and middle lobes, and new mild nodulation in the left upper lobe.overall, findings suggest dramatic progression of pneumonia.a component of pulmonary hemorrhage could be present.mild but multifocal central lymph node enlargement has been stable except for growth of 14 x 17 mm right hilar lymph node, previously 12 x 15 mm.no lymph nodes impinge on vital structures.there is no pericardial effusion.severe splenomegaly has worsened.just above the upper pole of the left kidney, maximum orthogonal diameters have increased from 80 x 123 mm to 94 x 133 mm, 2:61.
summary: severe progression of widespread pneumonia, now accompanied by the small layering non-hemorrhagic pleural effusion.there is no direct radiographic evidence that this represents empyema, but if the fluid volume continues to increase, sampling is recommended to distinguish pleural infection from reactive exudate.although mild-to-moderate central adenopathy has been relatively stable (with the exception of enlarging right hilar node), moderate splenomegaly has progressed substantially.diagnostic considerations of advancing multifocal consolidationi include legionnaires disease and similar infections.dr.___ and i discussed the findings and their clinical significance over the telephone at the time of dictation.

text: there are no filling defects in the main or segmental pulmonary arteries to suggest pulmonary embolism.the evaluation of subsegmental pulmonary arteries is limited by extensive parenchymal abnormalities.there is a moderate-sized pericardial effusion, not significantly changed in size.patient is status post median sternotomy, right upper lobe resection and the svc reconstruction.the airways are patent to the level of segmental bronchi bilaterally.there is a moderate right pleural effusion, slightly decreased in size from two weeks earlier.in the lung fields, there has been interval worsening of existing, and developing new patchy opacities bilaterally, involving left upper lobe, left lower lobe, and right lower lobe, likely representing extensive multi-focal infection.there has been interval increase in size of the prevascular, as well as ap window lymphatic nodes since previous examination.limited evaluation of upper abdominal organs is unremarkable.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolism.a significant interval worsening and development of new areas of airspace opacities in the both lung fields, that likely represent multi-focal infection, however given increase in size of mediastinal lymph nodes, progression of malignancy remains a possibility.differential diagnosis also includes interstitial edema.unchanged appearance of small left pleural effusion, and pericardial effusion, and slight decrease in the size of the right pleural effusion.status post thoracotomy and right upper lobe resection with reconstruction of svc, with stable appearance of postoperative changes.

text: prevascular, pretracheal, precarinal, subcarinal, and right hilar lymph nodes are increased in number and size since ___.the largest mediastinal node is precarinal, measuring 21 x 15 mm.the largest right hilar node measures 17 x 16 mm.there is complete occlusion/compression of the right mainstem bronchus.there is near complete collapse and consolidation of the right lung with shift of the mediastinal structures to the right.there is a small loculated right pleural effusion with evidence of talc.there is a tracheostomy.there is minor narrowing of the left mainstem bronchus immediately inferior to the main left pulmonary artery origin.the more distal left-sided bronchi appear patent to the segmental levels.there is a small amount of fluid or thickening in the left major fissure.the previously noted nodule in the left lower lobe, posterior to the major fissure, demonstrates interval enlargement.it currently measures 15 mm in diameter, compared to 10 mm on the prior study.the visualized portions of the liver, spleen, pancreas, adrenal glands, and kidneys appear unremarkable.there are no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions in the visualized osseous structures.
summary: progression of metastatic disease, with increased lymphadenopathy and interval enlargement of the left pulmonary nodule.complete obstruction of the right mainstem bronchus.near complete collapse and consolidation of the right lung.small loculated right pleural effusion.minor narrowing of the proximal left main stem bronchus.

text: 7 x 3.9 x 4.5 cm left hilar mass invades the left main stem bronchus at the origin of the left upper lobe bronchus.the mass encases all structures in the left hilus, surrounding the descending pulmonary artery, and extending medially along the left superior pulmonary vein without evidence of mediastinal invasion.the lingular bronchus is narowed with associated atelectasis and the left lower lobe bronchus is narrowed with distal reconstitution of the lower lobe airways, although mucous plugging and scattered peribronchiolar nodules in the left lower lobe likely represent retained secretions (400:40).there are no lymph nodes that are enlarged by ct size criteria although left paratracheal nodes measure up to 6 mm.bronchus intermedius stump is unremarkable following right middle and lower lobe resection responsible for mild right pleural thickening.a 4-mm right upper lobe pulmonary nodule is new (4:101).heart size is normal.trace pericardial effusion measures fluid density.although this exam was not optimized for subdiaphragmatic diagnosis, the imaged upper abdomen is unremarkable except to note contrast within the gallbladder.bone windows demonstrate no lesions suspicious for metastatic or infectious foci.
summary: left hilar mass invading the right main bronchus just proximal to the upper lobe orifice, surrounds and invades the left lower lobe and lingular bronchi and surrounds the mid left descending pulmonary artery, extending medially along the left superior pulmonary vein.no evidence of mediastinal invasion.new 4-mm upper lobe nodule is suspicious for metastasis.

text: evaluation of pulmonary arteries is limited by suboptimal bolus timing, however, there is no central pulmonary embolus identified.evaluation of the segmental and subsegmental arteries is limited.aorta is normal.the heart is normal.there is no mediastinal hematoma or central adenopathy.trachea and central airways are patent.there are no endobronchial lesions.in the lungs, there is no effusion, consolidation, or pneumothorax.atelectasis is seen at the left lung base.there is no pulmonary nodule or mass identified.
summary: enlarged heterogeneous uterus, likely reflecting tab one day prior.however, there is a large amount of heterogeneous fluid and debris within the endometrial canal.this may reflect hematometra, though retained products of conception cannot be excluded by ct and ultrasound is recommended for further evaluation.superinfection also cannot be excluded by ct imaging, and clinical correlation is advised.no free fluid or free air in the abdomen or pelvis to suggest uterine perforation.no evidence of pulmonary embolus within the limits of this study, which is limited by suboptimal bolus timing.heterogeneous enhancement of the kidneys may reflect phase of contrast timing, though correlation with urinalysis is recommended to exclude pyelonephritis.

text: the airways are patent up to subsegmental level.there are low lung volumes with breathing motion; however, no evidence of consolidation or contusion.there is no pleural effusion, or pneumothorax.there is cardiomegaly.there is no pericardial effusion.the vessels are of normal caliber.there is no evidence of pseudoaneurysm.there are no pathologically enlarged lymph nodes in the mediastinum, hilum, or axilla.
summary: cardiomegaly.l1 anterior wedge deformity, 50% loss of height, of uncertain chronicity.correlate with point tenderness.

text: the patient is status post pneumonectomy with mediastinal shift to the left.the left pneumonectomy space is filled with fluid, with post- surgical changes and periosteal reaction.a 2.5 x 2.3 cm mass is present in the right upper lobe, which has ill-defined margins and is new compared to the prior ct with adjacent pleural thickening.it abuts and extends along the minor fissure, and there is questionable extension into the adjacent middle lobe peripherally.new areas of inter- and intralobular peripheral septal thickening are noted in the right lung, predominantly at the right lung space.the airways are patent up to the segmental level.there is no pneumothorax or right-sided pleural effusion.the right lower paratracheal node measures 22 x 12 mm.there is thickening of the wall of the right main bronchus and bronchus intermedius consistent with hilar adenopathy.atherosclerotic coronary artery calcifications are noted.in the upper abdomen, a 9-mm hypodense lesion is seen in the right lobe of the liver, which was not seen on the prior ct of ___.the spleen, adrenals, and imaged kidneys are unremarkable.multiple osteolytic lesions are noted within the right scapula (2:1) and t7, t8, t9, t10 and t11 and t12 vertebral bodies.
summary: mass in the right upper lobe, suspicious for new primary lung cancer.the mass abuts the minor fissure and there is questionable extension into the right middle lobe periperally.a resolving focus of pneumonia is considered much less likely than neoplasm given this finding and the presence of apparent skeletal mets.interstitial lung disease may be nsip, unlikely due to lymphangitic spread.right paratracheal and right hilar adenopathy.osteolytic lesions in the thoracic spine and in right scapula suspicious for metastases.9-mm hypodense lesion in the liver.given that this is new, an ultrasound should be performed for further characterization.

text: there is no pulmonary embolism.the aorta opacifies normally, without evidence of aortic dissection.extensive bilateral airspace opacities are more prominent centrally, with relative sparing of the lungs peripherally.there is thickening of the fissures, right greater than left and marked intralobular septal thickening.moderate pleural effusions are present, right greater than left, with underlying relaxation atelectasis.these findings are consistent with pulmonary edema.there is no pericardial effusion.numerous mediastinal lymph nodes do not meet size criteria for pathologic enlargement, and are likely reactive.central airways are patent to the segmental level.there is a small hiatal hernia.limited imaging of the upper abdomen is otherwise unremarkable.note is made of right thyroid low-attenuating nodules.no suspicious lytic or blastic osseous lesion is identified.
summary: pulmonary edema.nodularity of the right thyroid lobe.please correlate with patient's history and thyroid function test.ultrasound can be obtained if further imaging is required.

text: examination of the pulmonary arteries show no evidence of pulmonary embolus, and examination of the aorta and great vessels demonstrates no evidence of dissection.
summary: no evidence of pulmonary embolus.no evidence of aortic dissection.slightly more prominent/enlarged appearances of multiple pulmonary abscesses, although the large air-containing one appears slightly smaller than before.

text: there is no axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy.again noted within both lungs are multiple small patchy foci of opacity, overall, slightly improved in appearance since the previous exam.there is no pleural effusion.there is a moderate sized pericardial effusion.
summary: slight interval decrease in the appearance of bilateral patchy lung opacities.new bowel wall thickening in a long segment of small bowel with associated small to moderate amount of ascites.this appearance is most suggestive of graft versus host disease, less likely infectious enteritis or vasculitis.findings discussed with dr.___ at the time of the study.

text: the pulmonary arteries opacify without filling defects.the heart is enlarged when compared to ___.there is small pericardial fluid.the great vessels of the mediastinum are unremarkable.multiple enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes are redemonstrated, grossly unchanged from ___, the largest in the subcarinal station measuring 14 mm in short axis.no pathologic axillary adenopathy is identified.an enlarged right hilar node measuring 15 mm in short axis is unchanged.there is a new loculated right pleural effusion with fluid extending into the right major fissure.there is a small left pleural effusion.in addition, there is thickening of the interlobular septa and bibasilar ground- glass opacities secondary to pulmonary edema.subsegmental atelectasis noted at both lung bases.the airways are patent to the subsegmental level.stable noncalcified pulmonary nodules are again seen in the right middle lobe measuring 5.8mm and in the left upper lobe measuring 6.3mm.the spleen is enlarged.the remaining visualization of the abdomen is unremarkable.
summary: new pulmonary edema.new bilateral pleural effusions (right greater than left).mediastinal lymphadenopathy, unchanged.multiple non-calcified pulmonary nodules which appear stable over 15 months, measuring up to 6 mm, likely representing granulomas or myeloid metasplasic pulmonary involvement.sesha

text: there are several small mediastinal lymph nodes, in right lower paratracheal area, 2:15, 6.5 mm, 2:27.5 mm, in subcarinal area, 2:24, 11 mm.small hilar lymph nodes are less than 5 mm on the left, 2:29 and no appreciable lymphadenopathy is demonstrated in the right hilus.the aorta is unremarkable except for arch calcifications.significant pulmonary artery dilatation is demonstrated, up to 3.6 cm at the level of right main pulmonary artery and up to 3.2 and 2.7 at the level of right main and left main arteries respectively.the patient is after cabg with stenting of one of the grafts.native coronary arteries are severely calcified.the heart size is moderately enlarged but stable.there is no pericardial effusion.external pacemaker leads are noted, 2:46.small hiatal hernia is unchanged.there is no pleural effusion and the pleural surfaces are smooth.the airways are patent to the level of subsegmental bronchi bilaterally.the patient is after right upper lobectomy.the appearance of the post-surgical sutures is unremarkable with no evidence of local tumor recurrence.minimal right middle lobe subpleural opacities might represent post-radiation changes, 3:25.right lower lobe subpleural nodule, 3:27, is 4 mm in diameter stable at least since ___.the lingular subpleural 3-mm nodule, 3:42 is stable since ___.there are no new nodules, masses or consolidations of concern.the patient is after median sternotomy with no evidence of sternal dehiscence.areas of increased lucency are noted within the sternum especially its lower portion, 3:29, 34 but most likely related to the sternotomy rather than representing metastatic lytic lesions.multiple post-surgical rib fractures are demonstrated on the right.there are no bone lesions worrisome for metastatic unremarkable within the limitation of this study which is not designed for evaluation of intra- abdominal pathology.calcifications of the aorta and its major branches are demonstrated.
summary: status post right upper lobectomy due to lung cancer.no current evidence of tumor recurrence.two stable sub 5-mm pulmonary nodules.pulmonary hypertension.coronary atherosclerosis.status post cabg.right renal cyst.

text: postoperative changes in the right hemithorax following lobectomy are again identified.there is no evidence of local recurrence at the bronchial stumps.there is mild centrilobular emphysema, unchanged.there are no pathologically enlarged axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymph nodes.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.the mediastinal structures are shifted towards the right, consistent with volume loss due to surgery.a left upper lobe subpleural nodule (4, 103 and 4, 70) is stable since ___, and measures 2 mm.the previously identified right lower lobe nodule measuring 9 x 6 mm (4, 168) is stable when compared to ___ and is minimally increased when compared to ___.no new nodules or masses are identified.there is no pericardial or pleural effusion.limited views of the upper abdomen demonstrate a large hiatal hernia.patient is status post cholecystectomy.soft tissue nodule in the anterior mesentery (2, 57) is noted and measures approximately 6 mm.
summary: no evidence of local tumor recurrence.6 x 9 mm right lower lobe nodule is stable when compared to ___ and minimally increased when compared to ___.no new or worrisome nodules are identified.hiatal hernia.mild emphysema.

text: an endotracheal tube is seen with tip positioned 4 cm above the carina.the ng tube courses inferiorly with its tip within the mid gastric body.the mediastinal great vessels opacify normally and there is no evidence of central pe or aortic injury.no mediastinal hematoma is present.no definite mediastinal lymphadenopathy is seen.no pericardial effusion or pleural effusion is seen.lung windows demonstrate no evidence of contusion or pneumothorax.bilateral dependent consolidation is likely related to atelectasis.there is a small amount of mediastinal gas along the pericardium on series 2, image 43 and a small amount of gas along the costophrenic recess along the right-sided rib fractures seen best on series 2, image 51 and 49.no mediastinal hematoma is seen.
summary: extensively comminuted fracture of the left femur extending from the trochanter to just below the femoral stem prosthesis.moderate volume hemoperitoneum likely secondary to liver laceration, though laceration cannot be clearly visualized.no evidence of active bleeding.right anterolateral rib fractures involving the fifth through seventh ribs with small amount of adjacent gas.bibasilar lung consolidation likely secondary to atelectasis.et and ng tubes positioned appropriately.no evidence of pe or acute aortic dissection.findings were discussed with the trauma team at the time of initial review.sesha

text: ct of thorax: normal appearance of the heart and great vessels.no enlarged mediastinal, hilar, or axillary lymph nodes are identified.there is minimal basilar atelectasis but no concerning discrete pulmonary nodules.no pleural or pericardial effusions are identified.
summary: no concerning thoracic lesions.sigmoid diverticulosis with no evidence of acute diverticulitis.iud in situ.no evidence of abdominal or pelvic malignancy.

text: the pulmonary arteries are adequately visualized down to the segmental branches.no filling defects are present to suggest pulmonary emboli.the heart is at the upper limits of normal in size.there is normal opacification of the thoracic aorta.the patient is status post median sternotomy and cabg.there are small mediastinal lymph nodes which are stable in the interval.there is no axillary lymphadenopathy.a right internal jugular central venous line is seen with the tip at the superior vena cava/right atrial junction.there is a stable subcentimeter calcified granuloma in the right upper lobe.plate-like atelectasis is present in the right upper lobe anteriorly.this appearance is stable from the prior study and may represent an element of scarring as well.bibasilar atelectasis is present.there is focal parenchymal opacity at the left lung base.this is concerning for infection or aspiration.the airways are patent down to the segmental bronchi.there are faint ground-glass opacities, predominantly in the perihilar regions.there is prominence of the pulmonary arteries in the upper lobes suggestive of redistribution.the osseous structures are unremarkable.
summary: no pulmonary embolism.left basilar parenchymal opacity, which may represent pneumonia vs.aspiration.this could also be an area of focal atelectasis.central faint ground-glass opacities and vascular redistribution suggestive of congestive heart failure.less likely, this could represent hypersensitivity pneumonitis.

text: there has been interval placement of a right chest tube, with the tip terminating within the posterior right upper hemithorax.there continues to be a large right-sided hemothorax, with new air seen within the pleural space, related to chest tube placement.at the site of the previously seen active extravasation in the right pleural space anteriorly is a linear focus of enhancement (3:74), which is concerning for continued active bleeding, likely from an intercostal vessel.hypodense foci along the surface of the right lung likely reflects trapped pleural fluid.the is associated near complete collapse of the right lung, though there is improved aeration of the right lung apex.there is a new small left pleural effusion, with associated areas of atelectases in the left lower lobe as well as the left upper lobe.the left lung is otherwise grossly clear.the heart is normal in size.atherosclerotic calcifications of the coronary arteries and aortic arch arch are noted.leftward mediastinal shift is stable.this exam is not tailored for subdiaphragmatic evaluation.a large hypodensity in the right lobe of the liver is not significantly changed prior study, and likely reflects changes related to rf ablation.additional areas of hypoattenuation within the liver peripherally are more apparent compared to the prior study, and also may reflect as sequela of rf ablation.no suspicious osseous lesion is identified.
summary: large right hemothorax with a linear focus of enhancement in the right pleural space anteriorly, at the site of previously seen active extravasation.this likely reflects continued active bleeding, likely from an intercostal vessel.associated near complete collapse of the right lung, though the right lung apex is better aerated.new small left pleural effusion and multifocal linear atelectasis within the left lung.findings were discussed with ___ ___ at approximately 4 p.m.

text: there is no pathologic appearing mediastinal, hilar or axillary lymphadenopathy.the heart, pericardium, and great vessels appear unremarkable.again seen are several calcified subcentimeter lymph nodes within the hila and subcarinal region.the central airways appear patent.there is bronchiectasis, most prominent within the lower lobes bilaterally.bilateral pulmonary nodules are again seen.the largest nodule, located in the right middle ___, measures 7 x 8 mm, decreased from the previous examination at which time it measured 8 x 10 mm.a lingular nodule is stable in size, measuring 6 x 6 mm.there are several clusters of centrilobular nodular opacity within the left upper ___.within the inferior aspect of the left upper ___, ___ area of clustered nodular opacities appears more conspicuous in the interval; however, this difference may likely relate to slice selection differences.there are dependent changes within the lower lobes bilaterally.there are patchy areas of air trapping.no pneumothorax and no pleural effusion.
summary: bilateral pulmonary nodules are stable to decreased in size.probable stability of centrilobular nodular opacities within the left upper ___.large extraluminal gas collection extending from right lateral aspect of the rectum to base of the penis and scrotum.findings are consistent with perirectal abscess or other gas producing infectious process.multiple punctate calcifications in the liver and spleen consistent with prior granulomatous infection.calcified and atrophic left kidney is suggestive of prior tuberculous infection.stable hypodense lesions in the right kidney and within the left ___ of the liver and caudate ___ of the liver, too small to accurately characterize.bilateral bowel-containing inguinal hernias without evidence of bowel obstruction.the findings were discussed with dr.___ ___ at the time of image interpretation (4:28 p.m.).

text: there is a right shoulder joint effusion measuring 5.2 x 3.8 cm, which extends anterolaterally from the humeral head with complex fluid contents.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there is diffuse calcification of the aorta and left main coronary artery.there is no abnormal hilar, mediastinal, or axillary lymphadenopathy.there is diffuse centrilobular emphysema with unchanged hyperinflation of the left lobe, causing mediastinal shift and displacement of the anterior junction line.again noted is bibasilar bronchiectasis, right greater than left, as well as bronchiectasis in the right middle lobe and lingula.there has been progressive consolidation within the right and left lower lobes with areas of airway impaction, concerning for aspiration.there has been interval development of small bilateral pleural effusions.
summary: increased bibasilar consolidation and pleural effusions, concerning for aspiration.development of mild ascites.right shoulder joint effusion.sigmoid diverticulosis.

text: heart and great vessels appear unremarkable and the lungs are clear without evidence of pneumothorax.there is mild bilateral dependent atelectasis.no pleural or pericardial effusion identified.no pathologically enlarged central or axillary lymph nodes are identified.there is a marked amount of prevertebral soft tissue swelling noted at the level of c7 and t1 from known underlying fracture-dislocation at this level.
summary: c7 and t1 fracture dislocation better described on dedicated c- spine report.no evidence of thoracic, abdominal or pelvis traumatic injury.cholelithiasis without evidence of acute cholecystitis.

text: two lines enter via the left internal jugular and right subclavian veins and terminate in the left brachiocephalic vein.an endotracheal and nasogastric tube are noted.the heart and great vessels are unremarkable.there are large bilateral pleural effusions with compressive atelectasis.there are no lung nodules.there are no enlarged mediastinal or axillary lymph nodes.
summary: moderate intraabdominal ascites without abscess.large bilateral pleural effusions.right subclavian and left ij lines both terminate in the left brachiocephalic vein.
